loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Becaause of cultural reasons, Bushra prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Bushra is 33 years old and married, from Bani Kenanah - Irbed in Jordan.  She has three children

She has requested a 600 JOD loan to buy sewing tools and fabrics to make clothes. In the future, she would like to buy sewing machines and expand her project, buying more machines and employing people to work with her.  She wants to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for buying sewing tools and fabrics

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is from the Bolnisi district. He is 25 years old and lives with his wife, mother, and grandmother. His grandmother is a pensioner. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where maize and haricots are grown. Azer owns a minibus and runs his own business. His business consists of selling different kinds of vegetables, fruits, and food products. He has been in this business for 5 years and is very well-known in the area.

Azer requested a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular vegetables and fruits, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. This will increase his income. With the increased income, Azer will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 48 years old and the mother of four children.  She lives at West Point with her husband, who is a driver.  Her children are between the ages of 18 and 27; they are all independent. 

She sells used clothes in the market.  She has been involved in this business for the past five years.  She sells both boys and girls clothes.  She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit, she improves the business and improves  her life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en: Ferial is a 42-year-old widow from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes and accessories to sell to her friends and neighbors. In the future, she would like to increase her product inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 25 years old, married, and lives in Sinkor. Her husband is a driver and they have two children aged 2 and 8; both are attending school. 

For 4 years, Cathrine has been selling rice. She wasn't able to attend school and says this is a business she can understand. She started with susu money (susu is a savings club). She likes being in business because she is able to save and do things by herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag for her business. 

In the future she wants to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vehicle-washing items for his service station.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en: Ramadhan is married and a father of three children, all of whom go to school. He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else besides them. He earns a living by selling construction blocks. He will use this loan to buy more blocks to sell. Ramadhan has been in this business for the last five years. In the future, he hopes to build a rental house. To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Yehu. His challenge is the high transport cost.

loans.use: To buy more blocks to sell

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the  daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute in the family income.

She is in the business of sewing for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, and needles.

loans.name: Eraj

texts.en:
Eraj is a 37-year-old man. He is married and the father of two children who are already in school.

He has been a builder for more than 12 years. He builds very wonderful houses, but he can’t build such kind of a wonderful house for himself because he does not have enough income for it. He wants to repair his house because he can’t afford to build a new house. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy building materials such as wood, cement and paint to repair his house.

This loan will help him buy building materials to repair his house. In this way, he will provide a higher quality of living conditions for his family and put an end to the problems with his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials as wood, cement and paint to repair his house.

loans.name: Oscar Osvaldo

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que buscando generar ingresos para contribuir en su hogar con sus padres, aprendió la actividad de la venta de productos de uso personal de un amigo que le enseñó y vio que era rentable. Por esto hace 1 mes decidió iniciar su propio negocio con un poco de dinero que tenía ahorrado y así comenzó a vender a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos productos de uso personal. A pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital, Oscar ha hecho un gran esfuerzo que le ha permitido sacar adelante su negocio y conseguir buenas ventas. Es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes que no logra satisfacer por la falta de capital.

De esta manera seguirá saliendo adelante con su negocio y podrá continuar contribuyendo económicamente en su hogar para que sus padres tengan una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Oscar is an enterprising young man who is twenty-two years old. He is looking to generate income to contribute to living expenses in his parents’ home. He learned to sell personal products from a friend who taught him, and he saw that it was profitable. As a result, he decided to start his own business last month with a little money he had saved. He started to sell personal products to his friends, relatives, and neighbors. Even though he does not have a lot of capital, Oscar has made a great effort which has allowed him to get ahead with his business and make good sales. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to purchase personal products and be able to fill the orders his customers have made which he has not been able to fill due to a lack of capital.

In this way, he will continue getting ahead with his business and will be able to continue contributing economically to his household living expenses so that his parents will have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase personal products and be able to fill the orders his customers have made which he has not been able to fill due to a lack of capital.

loans.name: Matu

texts.en: Matu resides with her husband at West Point. She is 27 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 8. They are currently in school. Matu has a restaurant in her community. With the good services that she renders to her customers, she makes a profit every day. She works six days a week. She prepares cassava leaves, okra sauce, palaver sauce, and palm butter to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business. Her plan for the future is to become an important businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Fawzeya

texts.en: Fawzeya is a 51-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan who has a 4-year-old child. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home's improvements. She wants to build a bathroom and to buy the household some new furniture. In the future she would like to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 38-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to expand the living room.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua, 39, is happily married and lives in the town of Likoni with her husband and three adult children. She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, focuses all their efforts into moving their family forward and ensuring that their children are educated.

For over ten years, Wayua has been running a retail shop, selling basic consumer goods like breads, sodas, flour, etc.

Wayua is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy larger amounts of merchandise like cooking fat, balers of flour, sacks of sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products so that her business will be better stocked with a wider variety of merchandise to increase sales and income. It will serve much so that in the not-too-distant future she’ll see her children become good professionals and responsible citizens.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of merchandise like cooking fat, balers of flour, sacks of sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products

loans.name: Yajaiza Elena

texts.es:
Yajaiza tomó clases hace 9 años en procesamiento de lácteos y luego aprendió mucho más de la actividad trabajando en una empresa durante 4 años. Cuando nació su primer hijo se dedicó al hogar y dejó atrás la actividad, pues no tenía quien cuidara de su hijo y a pesar de que las condiciones económicas de su hogar se deterioraban no tenía otra opción. Hace 1 mes retornó al negocio y decidió hacerlo de manera independiente montando su propio negocio, y aunque comenzó con muy poco capital y muy pocas unidades de yogurt a la semana, ahora su negocio ha crecido y tiene buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Yajaiza manifiesta que su mayor ventaja es poder trabajar en su casa y estar al cuidado de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, y al mismo aportar económicamente junto con su esposo al sostenimiento económico. Ahora que su negocio ha captado muy buenos clientes y tiene la oportunidad de vender grandes cantidades, Yajaiza busca un préstamo para comprar un fogón, ollas, canecas lecheras, y materia prima para poder hacer crecer el negocio.

De esta manera espera superar la dificultad de capital que tiene y sacar adelante su propio negocio, con el que su esposo y sus 2 hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida gracias a sus ingresos y en un futuro puedan tener mejores condiciones económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yajaiza took classes nine years ago in dairy processing and then she learned much more about it working in a business over the course of four years. When her first son was born, she devoted herself to home life and left her other activities behind, since she did not have anyone to care for her son and in spite of the fact that the economic conditions in her home deteriorated, she did not have a choice.

One month ago she returned to her business and she decided to do it independently by setting up her own business. Even though she started with very little capital and very few units of yogurt per week, now her business has grown and she has good orders from her customers. Yajaiza states that her biggest advantage is to be able to work in her house and be caring for her two children who are 3 and 5 years old at the same time as she is contributing economically, together with her husband, to the support of the household.

Now that her business has captured very good clients and she has the opportunity to sell large quantities, Yajaiza is seeking a loan to be able to buy a stove, pots, milk cans, and raw materials to be able to grow her business. In this way she hopes to overcome the trouble she has had with capital and propel her business forward. With this loan, her husband and two children will have a better quality of life thanks to their income, and in the future they can be in better economic conditions and they will progress.

loans.use: to purchase a stove, pots, milk cans, and raw materials to be able to grow her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, aged 30, lives at West Point with her husband and three children. The children are between the ages of 6 and 18, and her husband is a mechanic. Two of her children stay with her and are in school, while the other child stays with her aunt.

Annie has sold body cream, body powder, body spray, hair grease and hair accessories for the past three years. She likes to do this business because she makes a profit; with the profit, she improves the business and helps her husband with the household expenses.  

She has requested this loan to purchase more body spray, body cream and body powder for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, body cream and body powder for the business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia lives in Congo Town, is 48 years old, and married with three children between the ages of 18 and 20. Her husband is a school teacher. Cecelia has been selling pigs' feet for the past 20 years. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more pigs' feet for her business. She plans to improve the livelihood of her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs' feet for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a 30-year-old single woman. She has three children. Ten years ago she decided to open a general store. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. This is her first loan from Yehu and Kiva, and she requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 KES to buy a range of new products, such as snacks, sugar, beans, detergents, and beverages to restock her general store with. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. Mwanasiti gives her thanks in advance for the support given.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as snacks, sugar, beans, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Jonetta

texts.en:
Jonetta is 27 years old and lives in Sinkor. She stopped her education in the 9th grade. She is single.

Jonetta has been selling food items like pepper, onions, spices, oil, okra, etc. for the past 2 years. She likes her business because it makes her independent and she can do things on her own. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, oil, okra, salt, etc. She hopes to buy land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, oil, okra, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto aprendió la actividad de la fabricación de herraduras por parte de su padre quien siempre se dedicó a esta actividad, y desde muy temprano se la enseñó para trabajar a su lado. Gracias a esto, ahora tiene una experiencia de 20 años que le permiten fabricar herraduras de muy buena calidad, lo que a su vez le ha permitido captar bastantes clientes para su negocio. Ernesto es padre cabeza de hogar donde convive con su hijo de 6 años, pues la madre de su hijo los abandonó hace un tiempo y por tanto las cargas económicas de su hogar han recaído encima suyo; esto ha hecho que las condiciones en su hogar estén pasando por grandes dificultades y Ernesto espera con su trabajo poder salir adelante. Buscando superar una gran dificultad de capital que tiene, Ernesto busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas y fabricar las herraduras de unos grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder salir adelante y ofrecerle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida en un futuro y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Además, aspira a poder ofrecerle una educación de mejor calidad y cuando tenga la necesidad, poder ofrecerle el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Ernesto learned to make horseshoes from his father, who always made horseshoes, and who taught Ernesto from a young age to work alongside him. Thanks to this experience, Ernesto now has twenty years of experience making high quality horseshoes, which has also allowed him to earn many customers for his business. Ernesto is a father and the head of the household where he lives with his six year old son. The mother of his son left them a while ago, and as a result, the economic duties of the household have fallen on him. This situation has made it so that he is experiencing great difficulties providing for his child, and Ernesto hopes to continue working at his trade to be able to get ahead. Ernesto is looking to overcome the great difficulty he is having with capital and is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials so he can make horseshoes for some large orders his customers have made.

Ernesto’s dream is to be able to get ahead and offer his son a good quality of life in the future and better economic opportunities to get ahead. Additionally, he hopes to be able to offer him a better quality education and, when the time comes, access to a university education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials so he can make horseshoes for some large orders his customers have made.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is married with one child. For the past two years, she has operated a grocery store at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Linda sells tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, and other items. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their child’s school fees.    

Linda is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Imtithal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Imtithal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus the above photo is of her husband. Imtithal is a 40-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home's improvements. She would like to repaint the rooms and add decorations. In the future she wants to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Shakuul

texts.en: Shakuul lives together with her husband and 4 children in Edudrom, near Cape Coast. Her husband is a labourer at the University of Cape Coast. Shakuul operates a grocery shop, which she has had for 8 years. The items in her grocery shop are rice, cooking oil, tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, and soap. Shakuul uses her income to support her husband in paying their childrens' school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits, Shakuul plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small catering business, which sells fast foods like fried fish, chips, and chicken. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits, develop her business, and build a restaurant. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus, a 38-year-old grocery store owner in Kisauni, Mombasa, is married to Mary with whom he has five children aged 17, 15, 13, 12 and 10 years. He has been successfully running the store for the past four years.

This is Cosmus’ first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas, and will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop for his wife. He hopes to have his own permanent residential house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. She lives in the Congo town area and has run a restaurant for the past 15 years. Hannah stopped her education at the third grade. Her husband is not presently working and the family depends on her for their livelihood. 

Hannah is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, charcoal, and pepper for her restaurant. In the future, she hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal, and pepper for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que ha tenido que atravesar grandes dificultades en la vida, y que gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar todas estas adversidades. Desde hace unos 4 años su esposo se quedó sin empleo y con la necesidad de generar los ingresos para su hogar donde conviven con sus 2 hijos, Maria decidió montar una tienda general con mucho esfuerzo y ahora esta es la fuente de ingresos para su hogar. A menudo su esposo le colabora cuando no tiene trabajos para hacer y a veces también su hijo menor le ayuda para sacar adelante este negocio. Entre los tres han venido poco a poco superando las dificultades que se le presentan en la tienda y así la calidad de vida del hogar ha venido mejorando. Para superar una dificultad de capital que tiene, Maria busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda con productos que se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking person who has had to overcome great difficulties in her life.  Thanks to her drive to get ahead, she has been able to overcome all of these challenges.  

Four years ago, her husband was without work and they needed to earn income for their household that they share with their two children.  Maria decided to open a general store, which took a lot of effort, but is now the source of income for their household.  When her husband does not have other work, he helps in the store, and sometimes her younger son helps her as well.  Between the three of them, they have slowly been overcoming the difficulties with the store and so their quality of life has been improving.  To overcome a lack of capital that she has, Maria is asking for a loan to purchase basic items to stock her store since they have run out of some items.  

Her dream is to improve her business and allow her family to have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase basic items to stock her store.

loans.name: Junior Antonio

texts.es:
Junior es un joven de 22 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo posee playas hermosas, una gastronomía variada y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta disfrutar en algunas ocasiones uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones. Desde muy joven Junior tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que sus padres son humildes, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Junior trabaja en su pequeño negocio de servicio de planchado y pintura de vehículos, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que el pintar los vehículos tomas mucho tiempo; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Junior está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para su negocio como pinturas, masilla, entre otros, así d esta  manera ella podrá tener los implementos necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Junior is a very hard-working and, above all, enthusiastic youth, 22 years of age. He lives in the city of Camana, known for its hot climate, beautiful beaches, a varied gastronomy and, above all, its very amiable people. When he has free time, Junior likes to play football with friends and neighbors from his barrio. He also likes to enjoy, on occasions, one of his favorite plates, which is the tasty “Chupe de Camarones” [Peruvian Shrimp Chowder]. Since he was quite young, Junior has had to work because his parents were very poor. For that reason, he could study only to the 5th grade of secondary school. But he would have liked to study for a career at the university.

Day after day, Junior works on vehicles in his small business, a body and paint shop. He works around 9 hours a day because painting vehicles takes much time. He thinks the business is going well, since he is very responsible and considerate with his customers.

Junior is very grateful for Kiva lenders who, thanks to the help they have offered, make it possible for him to purchase materials for his business, such as paints and body putty, among other items -- the materials he needs to carry out his work. This will permit him to continue struggling each day to make a reality of his grand dream: “To have his own house.”

loans.use: to buy body putty and other repair supplies for his body and paint shop.

loans.name: Gustavo Alberto

texts.es:
Gustavo se dedicó por más de 30 años a la actividad de la construcción y con esta generaba los ingresos que requería en su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos que allí se generaban, pero debido a problemas de salud se vio en la obligación de dejar esta actividad de lado y fue así como encontró la oportunidad de vender jugos de caña. Ya hace año y medio que inició con esta actividad y a pesar de no contar con un gran capital para sacarlo adelante, siempre se ha esforzado para poder salir adelante, por esto ahora tiene buenas ventas y espera seguir creciendo. Para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo, Gustavo busca un préstamo para comprar un parasol más grande y protegerse del sol y una nevera plástica para almacenar el hielo.

De esta manera espera poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y su calidad de vida mejore considerablemente, además de que podrá ofrecer cada vez mejores productos a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gustavo worked in construction for more than 30 years.  This work generated the income he needed to meet his household expenses.  Due to health problems, he decided to stop this work and found an opportunity to sell sugarcane juice.  He started this work a year and a half ago, and although he does not have much money to get ahead, he has always made an effort to improve.  Now, he has good sales and hopes that they will continue growing.  

In order to have better working conditions, Gustavo is asking for a loan to purchase a larger umbrella to protect himself from the sun, and a plastic cooler to keep ice in.  In this way, he hopes to have better working conditions and improve his quality of life considerably.  He will be able to offer better products to his customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a larger umbrella to protect him from the sun and a plastic cooler for ice.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin anteriormente trabajaba como empleado pero debido a que los ingresos que allí generaba no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio con el que ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos y poco a poco ir superando la dificultad de capital con la que cuenta en su hogar. Hace un tiempo inició con su tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar y a pesar de que inició el negocio con muy poco capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades y así seguir progresando con su familia. Gracias a su tienda, la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos ha mejorado considerablemente, por esto sigue buscando mejorar las ventas para seguir teniendo una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación de mejor calidad. Buscando superar su dificultad de capital, Martin busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda para mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es montar un minimercado y darle continuidad a su actividad para seguir ofreciendo en su hogar el sustento necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Martin previously worked as an employee, but since the income he earned there was insufficient to cover his household expenses, he decided to start his own business. Now he has the opportunity to generate more income and little by little begin to overcome the lack of capital he is experiencing in his home. He started his general store, where he offers his customers staple products, a while ago. Despite the fact that he started his business with very little capital, his effort has helped him to overcome great difficulties and continue to help his family get ahead. Thanks to his store, his wife and children’s quality of life has improved considerably. For this reason, he continues to look to improve sales so he can continue to have a better quality of life and offer his children a better quality education. Martin is looking to overcome his lack of capital.  He is requesting a loan to purchase staple products and to stock his store so he can improve sales.

His dream is open a mini supermarket, continuing his trade, so he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase staple products and to stock his store so he can improve sales.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in West Point. She is 35 years old, married and has four children, ages 5 to 19. Her husband is a carpenter. Three of her children live with her and attend school; the other child lives with her sister. She has been selling used clothes for the past four years. She sells children's clothes for both boys and girls. She makes profit when she sells and with the profit she buys goods to improve the business and helps her husband with the family expenses. She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married and has four children. Her husband is a laborer at the University of Cape Coast. For the past three years, Abena has produced charcoal to sell at Edukrom, Cape Coast. She uses her income to support her husband and feed and pay their children’s school fees.  

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. She will use the profit from her expanded business to produce larger quantities of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ayesah

texts.en:
Ayesah is a 42-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has three family members. Due to cultural reasons, she prefers that her photo not appear on the internet and therefore her husband is in this photo. 

Ayesah is requesting a 600 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to buy an air conditioner and new furniture. In the future, Ayesah hopes to improve her socioeconomic status.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and new furniture

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: La socia es la señora Maruja, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial en su tienda de abarrotes, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como Arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros. Maruja se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido educar a sus hijos quienes son estudiantes universitarios, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería que le permita capitalizar su comercio y segur pagando la educación de sus hijos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Maruja pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Maruja is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Urubamba province.  She continues to work at her grocery store selling staple products such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and other items.  With this store, Maruja has been able to educate her children, who are university students.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise which will allow her to capitalize her business and continue paying for her children's education.  For this reason, she is very thankful to Kiva for helping her develop her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Maruja is a member of the San Jose de Urubamba community bank located in the Urubamba province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 41 years old and married to Joseph. The couple does not have any children but they support six of Edith's siblings. For the past three years, Edith has owned rental houses and she earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

Edith is requesting her second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase building materials to complete her rental rooms. She will use her anticipated profit to support her family. In the future, Edith dreams of owning more real estate.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to complete her rental rooms

loans.name: Flor Angela

texts.es:
Flor aprendió la actividad de la confección desde hace unos 25 años y así comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de confecciones. Luego de 15 años de haber trabajado en esta empresa, se vio en la obligación de dejar el trabajo y dedicarse en su hogar a cuidar sus 2 hijos, labor que desempeñó hasta los últimos años cuando el padre de sus hijos los abandonó y así las cargas económicas del hogar quedaron todas sobre Flor. Para poder generar los ingresos que requería en su hogar para poder sacar sus 2 hijos adelante, Flor compró una máquina básica y comenzó a confeccionar nuevamente, y ahora gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos tiene muy buenos clientes. La dificultad que tiene es que por la falta de una máquina no puede confeccionar las prendas completas y esto hace que su pago sea muy bajo; es por esto que Flor busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora que le permita recibir los pedidos de la confección de prendas completas y así sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente.

Flor espera que las condiciones económicas en su hogar mejoren considerablemente y sus 2 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Flor learned to sew twenty-five years ago, and even started working as a seamstress for a clothing company. After fifteen years of working for this company, she was obligated to stop working and stay at home to care for her two children, which she did until recently, when the father of her children left them. As a result, the economic duties of the household have fallen on her. To be able to generate the income necessary to provide for her two children and help them to get ahead, Flor purchased a basic sewing machine and began to sew again. Now, thanks to the quality of her work, she has very good customers. The difficulty she has is that since she does not have the right machine, she cannot make whole clothing, and her payment is very low. For this reason, Flor is requesting a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine which will allow her to take orders for whole clothing and her income will increase considerably.

Flor hopes that the economic conditions in her home improve considerably, and that her two children will be able to have a better quality of life and access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine which will allow her to take orders for whole clothing and her income will increase considerably.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth aprendió desde muy temprana edad la actividad de la confección y esto le ha permitido tener una gran experiencia en el trabajo, brindando a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad. Anteriormente con su taller de confección contribuía económicamente en su hogar para tener una economía más estable, pero desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó, todas las responsabilidades económicas del hogar han caído encima suyo y por esto ha venido trabajando fuertemente para poder aumentar los ingresos con los que pueda sostener todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Buscando ofrecer mayores servicios a sus clientes, Yaneth busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora y así aumentar los trabajos que realiza para mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar junto con sus 2 hijos y mejorar las condiciones económicas para que puedan salir adelante accediendo a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yaneth learned how to sew from a young age.  This has allowed her to have a lot of experience with this work and to provide her customers with very good quality products.  Her sewing workshop used to contribute financially to her household to have stable finances, but since the father of her children abandoned them, all of the financial responsibilities of the household have fallen on her.  She is working very hard to increase her income so that she can meet her household expenses.  She would like to offer better services to her customers, so Yaneth is asking for this loan to purchase a serging machine to expand the work she is able to do and increase her income.  

Her dream is to provide her two children with a better quality of life and improve her financial condition so that her family can get ahead and her children can get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a serging machine to expand the types of work she can do to increase her income.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is 26 years old. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. Mwanalima works every day at her small shop selling spare parts. Mwanalima is a very hardworking woman and wants above all to prosper and improve her quality of life. She attributes the success of her business to her amiable character and to the fact that she sells quality products at affordable prices. 

Mwanalima is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts for her shop. She will use her loan to offer more variety and improve her income. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to keep working every day towards her greatest dream: having more selling points for her spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver. For some years, Theresa has cooked and sold different kinds of food including rice, yam, banku, vegetable sauce, fried fish, and meat stew. She sells her food at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Theresa uses her income to support her husband and help feed their children.

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables and other ingredients she needs to prepare her food. She will use the profit from her loan to acquire a location to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables, and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria aprendió la actividad empíricamente hace 10 años más o menos cuando le ayudaba a vender en un almacén a un hermano, y desde entonces ha estado trabajando en diferentes actividades como empleada en un cultivo de flores, como propietaria de unas ventas de mercancía y también con comidas rápidas, y así aportaba económicamente en su hogar para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Hace unos 6 meses le compró la papelería a una amiga que la vendió por falta de tiempo para poderla trabajar y desde entonces trabaja todos los días durante todo el día. La falta de capital ha sido la única dificultad que se le ha presentado en el negocio, y buscando superarla es que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de papelería y surtir su almacén de los productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante, conseguir su casa propia y que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Over the past 10 years, Gloria learned her business through experience, more or less by helping her brother sell merchandise in his store. She has also worked at various jobs to pay household expenses and improve her family's financial position: employee at a flower farm; owner of a store; and fast food vendor. Six months ago, she bought a stationery store from a friend, who was selling because she didn't have time to work. Since then, Gloria has worked there every day throughout the day. 

Her only business problem has been lack of working capital. To address this issue, she is requesting a loan to buy stationery and to restock items she has sold out of. Her dream is to improve her family's well being and to have better business opportunities so that she can get ahead, buy a house, and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy stationery and to restock items she needs at her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with four children who are all currently in school. She lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells flasks, juice, biscuits, and other items. 

Rebecca is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to more posho, flasks, bowls, and other household goods. Her loan will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and allow her to buy more goods to sell. She hopes that in the future she will be able to sell more quality products. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more posho, flasks, bowls, and household goods

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Doña Sandra tiene 53 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace 4 años que ella estableció en casa su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como blusas, pantalones, cortinas, sabanas, jeans, y también joyas en plata como cadenas, aretes, anillos, pulseras, etc. las ventas son de acuerdo a pedidos que hacen sus clientes. doña Sandra ha sido cliente de 17 préstamos con ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en el negocio, va comprar mas mercadería para cumplir con los pedidos que han hecho los clientes. Su meta es mantener siempre estable el negocio ya que es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 53, is married and has three children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Four years ago she established her own business in her house.  She sells merchandise like blouses, pants, curtains, sheets, and jeans.  She also sells silver jewelry like chains, earrings, rings, and bracelets, etc.  Her sales are made according to her customers’ orders.

Sandra has been a client of ODEF for 17 loans.  She will invest the current loan she is requesting for 21,000 lempiras in the business.  She will buy more merchandise to fill the orders that her customers have made.

Her goal is to always keep her business stable because it is a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, sheets, curtains, and silver jewelry like chains, rings, bracelets, and earrings, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 30-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. Due to cultural reasons, she prefers that her photo does not appear on the Internet and her husband is in this picture.

Rania is requesting a 400 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to repaint a room and maintain her home. In the future, Rania wants to provide a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, the mother of five children, is a 43-year-old farmer who strives to make a living by growing rice on her 1 1/2 hectare farm as her main source of income. Her husband is not only helping her with the rice field, but also producing sugar from sugar palm juice. With the 25 years that she has experience in her rice growing business, she is able to earn 13,500 riels (KHR) per day. 

Vanna has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for the past two cycles. She has wisely managed her loan in order to better support her business. She has had success, especially by purchasing fertilizer to boost her crop production on time, and is generating a decent income for her family. 

Now, Vanna is in a group composed of two members; the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle only. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for a 650,000 KHR loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. Also, she will use some of it to buy a high ladder made from bamboo for climbing palm trees and a bamboo container for sugar palm juice storage.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and a bamboo ladder for climbing sugar palm trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a chicken coop, buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Reynaldo, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en la provincia de Urubamba, Reynaldo se sigue dedicando a la minería en la región de Puerto Maldonado, a donde debe trasladarse frecuentemente para realzar sus actividades. Reynaldo está solicitando el préstamo para comprarle un motor a su unidad vehicular la cual le sirve como herramienta de trabajo y que aún no pudo adquirir precisamente por falta de dinero.
Reynaldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. Reynaldo tiene un sueño a futuro, y es la de poner una  empresa de transporte con varios vehículos que cubran la ruta del Cusco a Puerto Maldonado. Reynaldo pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 44, is married, has 2 children, and lives in Urubamba province. He is a miner in the Puerto Maldonado area and must commute there often to work. Reynaldo is requesting a loan to buy an engine for his vehicle, which is key to getting to work. However, he hasn't had the money to purchase it. 

Reynaldo thanks KIVA for helping him financially and letting him provide for his children's education and offer them a brighter future. His dream is to own several vehicles and provide transit service from Cusco to Puerto Maldonado. Reynaldo belongs to the communal bank “San Jose de Urubamba” in Urubamba province in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en:
Amenah is a 45-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, in Jordan. She has three children and requested a 500 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for making pickles at home and selling them. In the future she wants to increase her capital and expand her business to making several kinds of pickles.

For cultural reasons, Amenah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for making pickles for sale

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana 45 years old and lives with her husband and mother. She is from the Marneuli district. Liana's mother has a retirement pension and her family is involved in an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where they grow potatoes and maize. In addition, Liana runs a small dairy business. She has a milk cow and produces cheese. The family sells their produce locally. Besides these activities, Liana hires out her services as a farm worker to other local farmers to earn additional income. 

Liana is requesting a loan to purchase a milk cow to produce and sell more cheese. She wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. Liana will reinvest her profit into her business as well as spend more to improve her family's living conditions and provide for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is from Kisauni, Mombasa, and operates a small barber hair salon. He wants to remodel his salon in order to offer his clients a more comfortable environment, and generate more income to help support his family. He is requesting this loan in order to help grow his business.

He is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. He has much experience in his field, and knows what he is doing. His goal is to one day have a large barber salon, and to be widely known for his talent. He is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to him. With the loan, he wants to establish a clothes selling stall and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.use: to establish a clothes selling stall and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Irene Elmilia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Irene, ahora tiene 46 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de compra y venta de alimento para animales de corral, principalmente con productos como pasto, forraje y alfalfa, pero ahora también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ovejas, patos, gallinas y cuyes. Irene se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido educar a sus hijos quienes están en edad escolar, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería  y ovejas que le permita capitalizar su comercio y segur pagando la educación de sus hijos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su comercio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Irene pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Irene is now 46, married with 2 children, and lives in Urubamba province. She continues to buy and sell feed, mainly grass, fodder, and alfalfa, for farm animals. She also raises and sells small livestock such as sheep, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs. Irene has kept working in this manner, which allows her to educate her school-aged children.

Irene is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and sheep so that she can leverage her business and keep paying her children's school expenses. She thanks KIVA for helping her develop her business and promises to make her payments on time. Irene is a member of the communal bank “San Jose de Urubamba” in Urubamba province in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy sheep, grass, fodder, and alfalfa.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children at Edukrom near Cape Coast. 

Aba sells corn dough, gari (cassava flakes), and maize. She has done this for a year. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for her dough, onions, and maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her dough, onions, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa lives together with her four children. Her husband is a laborer at the University of Cape Coast. Adwowa produces charcoal to sell at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 20 years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwowa will produce charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba produces charcoal to sell at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 30 years now.  Aba is a widow and has three children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and to pay her children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business  Aba will produce charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Mbwana bought bundles of vegetables for resale as well as fresh vegetables that he sold, increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, because his sellers have requested more products. He has an established clientele and his working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful, because he will respond to demand by buying fruit and vegetables from the harvest at a good price and above all, very fresh. Mbwana tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives together with her husband, who is a carpenter, and 6 children at Edukrom near Cape Coast.  Abena is a petty trader. She sell salted fish, tubers of yams, and other food items, which she has done for 6 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Abena will use her loan to purchase salted fish, tubers of yams and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase salted fish, tubers of yams and other food items to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs (an eggplant-like fruit used as a vegetable), oil, and other food items. Ama has been in this business for ten years now.  

She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is married and one of the breadwinners in a family that consists of three members including her one daughter. Her entire family is living in Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, where rice farming is a common business to generate income for the villagers as well as for Sokhoeurn. Besides working on the rice field, this couple also raises pigs at home for additional income. The current business that she has been with for 11 years earns her about 13,000 riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the first loan cycle for Sokhoeurn and her fellow group member (they are in the same group of two female members). She and her co-member are applying for loan portions of 700,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. Sokhoeurn, the group leader, will use her portion to buy an additional plot of land to expand her rice planting and buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fatten her pig so she can sell for a good price and keep up good progress with her living conditions. She hopes to mount up profit from her current business and improve her standard lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of land and more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda sells charcoal at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for 13 years now.  

Matilda is married and has six children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children and pay their school fees.  

Matilda will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Matilda will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Loudan

texts.en:
Loudan is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Loudan has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells shirts, skirts, belts and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Loudan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more women's suits, school uniforms, and belts, and will help Loudan to generate greater profits and increase her sales due to wider variety of stock. Loudan hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Loudan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loudan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more women's suits, school uniforms, and belts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy operates a grocery shop at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years. The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.  She is married and has five children. Mercy uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Mercy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel has been able to sell fast food products thanks to his previous Kiva loan with which he bought vegetables for resale. Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan, which he will use to buy raw materials such as rice, oil, potatoes, and cereals in large quantities and supplies, expecting an increase in products. He can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. He sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes and cereals in large quantities.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 37 años de edad, está casada con Clemente, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 19, 16, 10 y 8 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola y ganadero. Norma es una mujer constante y trabajadora. Desde los 18 años viene laborando en los campos de cultivos que sus padres le otorgaron. Por su parte Clemente también posee terrenos por su herencia. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papas de las variedades: “Yungay” y “Jilguero”. Producción que vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Estas papas se venden mejor, sus precios son mejores y siempre se mantienen”, menciona.
El trabajo en el campo no es sencillo, y más aún cuando tiene hijos en edad escolar, a quienes atiende para luego dedicarse a sus sembríos.
Norma desea sembrar más papas en este mes, ya que la temporada de siembras se acerca. Por eso requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, y se siente a gusto con el sistema de trabajo de su cuenta interna.
Norma invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes y guano de corral, para iniciar una siembra, porque ya cuenta con las semillas.
texts.en:
Norma is 37 years old and is married to Clemente, with whom she has four children who are 19, 16, 10 and 8 years old. They live in their own house attached to a ranch. Norma is a hardworking and persevering woman. From the age of 18 she worked in the fields her parents gave her. Clemente also has his own land which he inherited. Norma grows Yungay and Jilguero potatoes, and sells her crop in the largest market in Tarma. She says that her potatoes always sell well and she has the best prices.

Work in the fields isn't easy, especially with children of school age, who she has to look after before she can attend to her fields. Norma wants to sow more potatoes this month, as the planting season is getting closer. This is why she needs your support. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She gives her word to be punctual with her monthly payments. She is a member of the communal bank 'Mirando un futuro mejor' ('Looking to a better future'), and she is pleased that the system lets her work for herself. Norma will invest the money in buying bags of fertiliser and guano from poultry so she can start sowing, as she already has the seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and guano from poultry.

loans.name: Khiriah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Khiriah. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Amnh is 46 years of age. She is a married woman and has nine children. Her business is a retail one; she sells perfumes, incense, and clothes.  

She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business. The profits generated will allow her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Josephine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells shoes for children to wear at school. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and help cover basic needs and school fees. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business a lot. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas sells charcoal in Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now. Dorcas is a married and has 5 children. She uses her income to support her husband in order to feed their family and pay their children’s school fees. Dorcas will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Dorcas will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila sells dry fish, garden eggs and gari in Edukrom near Cape Coast. Leila has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is married with 7 children and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Leila will use her loan to purchase dry fish, vegetables and bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish, vegetables and bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Kazingo

texts.en: Kazingo is 43 years old and has been in a committed relationship for several years. She is a tailor and has been in this line of work for more than five years. She has a large clientele because she is well known. She works on orders placed with her and also has a stock of garments ready to sell. Thanks to this activity, she has moved forward, her business has grown little by little and she is able to maintain her home and educate her children. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase fabric, which she will use to finish orders that have been placed with her. She does not want to make her customers wait. She is a responsible person with a desire to continue working and progressing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en:
Milly's group is comprised of two hard working women. Milly is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Milly has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells childrens' shoes. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell and will help Milly to generate greater profits and help the development of her family. Milly hopes that in the future, she will be able to stop renting after buying a plot of land and building on it. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sonnieway

texts.en: Sonnieway is 40 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 21, who live at home and attend school. For the past ten years, Sonnieway has been selling clothes and slippers. Sometimes her customers use credit and refuse to pay. She started this business with 5,000 Liberian dollars, which her husband gave her. She is requesting a loan to purchase a carton of slippers and clothes for her business. She hopes to go back to school and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a carton of slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is involved in retail. She rents a little store in one of the markets in the town of Tiribe, where she has been trading clothing since 2010. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to increase her inventory of clothes.

Elizabeth has applied for this new loan to add more bales of clothes to her inventory in her store, as demand for a variety of clothing has increased recently. This is important for Elizabeth to meet her clients' demand and increase sales.

Elizabeth lives with her husband and one child.

Development of her business will bring more income for her and help her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to add more bales of clothes to the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Perparim

texts.en:
Perparim is thirty-two years old and has two children, seven and five years old, both of them going to school. His family lives in northern Albania.

For the past twelve-something years, he has been raising cows to generate profit by selling dairy and baby calves to the local market. Everyone in his family is involved in the business and it’s considered by them “family activity”, the little kids said.

Perparim is requesting a loan now to rebuild the stable that was badly damaged last winter, and the loan from Kiva will help him to build just that. His further plans include increasing the number of animals and, of course, with the profit from this, Perparim wants to improve the living conditions.

Perparim is an appreciative man who wants to thank all the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to rebuild his damaged stable.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a petty trader who sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, oil and other food items. Mary has been in this business for 10 years now.  She is married and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Mary will use her loan to purchase palm oil and a variety of vegetables to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Zulaika has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells and cooks chips, eggs and meats. 

To help expand her business, Zulaika has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more irish potatoes, charcoal and chicken to sell, and will help Zulaika to generate greater profits and help to buy a plot of land and build on it. Zulaika hopes that in the future, she will be able to drive herself. 

Zulaika is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more irish potatoes, charcoal and chicken to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has four children to support. For the last five years, she has been selling clothes at retail. She stocks her business with various clothes for adults and children and supports her family with the income. She will use the loan to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, khangas, etc. to attract more customer attention and purchases.

In the future, she plans to open a boutique. This way, she will be able to continue providing a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, khangas, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La socia es la señora Dominga, ahora tiene 55 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Dominga se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, papas, carnes y verduras, que le permitan seguir produciendo sus alimentos y  capitalizar su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Dominga, the member, is 55 years old.  She is married with seven children and lives in Urubamba province.  She continues her business selling food as a street vendor.  She has supported herself with this business, which has enabled her to get ahead and raise her children.  She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, meat, and vegetables, which will enable her to continue preparing her food and to finance her business.  For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva for enabling her to develop her business and she pledges to make all of her payments on schedule.  Dominga belongs to the “San Jose de Urubamba” Communal Bank in Urubamba province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children, aged 6 months and 14. They all stay with her at West Point. Her husband is a driver. For the past ten years, she has been selling coal by retail in her community. She started as a housemaid, before getting into her business. She likes to do this business because she earns her own income generated from her business and is able to help with the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Dennis has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells cement, iron bars and paint. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more paint, iron sheets, varnish and cement, and will help Dennis to generate greater profits and increase his family's prospects. Dennis hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another business.

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more paint, iron sheets, varnish and cement.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a married man with two young children, and both of them are dependent. His wife is also a business woman.

Together they set up a retail shop in their house, which is located in a strategic place in the city. He says they started with a little capital that they got from other jobs they had done previously as salaried workers. Thanks to the work they are doing, they have been able to contribute economically to the household expenses.

He is requesting the loan to buy basic needs products to stock his store. He will buy things like rice, bales of flour, sugar, and other items. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving. It is a great growth opportunity for him.

loans.use: to buy things like rice, bales of flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en: Famata is a 35-year-old hard-working mother that live at west point, with her husband and three children, ages 6 and 18. Her husband works for a government agency. She has been involved in her business for the past ten years, selling rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc., in the community market. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit every day. With the profit she improves her business and contributes to paying household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc., to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sale.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en: Dzine is a humble merchant of fruits and vegetables who fights day after day to improve her living conditions. To contribute to home expenses, her husband works as a businessman. This is how they support themselves to help their children move forward. Dzine needs this loan to purchase more groceries for her grocery store, such as potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, kale, etc. Her dream is to improve her living standards and to see her children have a professional career. She appreciates the support from Kiva through Yehu as they have shown confidence in giving her a loan to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her grocery store such as potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, kale, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives with her three children. She makes a living selling household utensils like thermos, plates, etc. She has had her business for several years and that has given her a lot of experience in sales. She has a large and loyal clientele who prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need in terms of quality products at affordable prices. Her service is also unique because it is always based on her customers’ orders.

Patricia is a very enterprising and determined woman who is eager to get ahead and is always looking for opportunities that will lead her to success. She knows that the harder she works, the greater the reward will be. In the last few months the demand for her products has increased, and so she wants to take this opportunity to invest in her business but needs capital for that. That is why she is asking Yehu for a loan that will allow her to purchase cooking pans, thermos, jugs and other products as requested by her customers.

Patrica is confident that she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pans, thermos, jugs and other products

loans.name: Antia

texts.en:
Antia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past year, Antia has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells matoke (plantain), sweet potatoes, and other raw foods. 

To help expand her business, Antia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for her business, and will help Antia to generate greater profits and improve her business and pay school fees. Antia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land and build a house. 

Antia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La socia es la señora Carmen, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, soltera con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de comercialización de golosinas, las cuales distribuye en las diferentes tiendas y comercios de su comunidad.
