The name of this group is  “Maa Santoshi” (named after a Hindu goddess .This group was formed in the year 2009 and includes six women members who are in the Below Poverty Line category from the village of Chhatapipal in the district of Bolangir in Odisha; India. Bolangir district is one of the poorest districts in India. The main issue in Bolangir is migration for daily labor. Lata is one of the members of this group. She is standing second from the left in the photo in a blue colored sari. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband, two sons (8 & 6 years old) and one daughter (13 years old). All her children are attending school in the same village. She has a little patch of land where her husband cultivates vegetable. Lata is running a milk business since last 5 years. She has two cows. She purchased one of the cows with her previous loan. Lata is getting 10 liters of milk per day. Her husband supplies this milk to a milk processing unit in a nearby village. To maintain her family of five, the present income is insufficient and Lata is facing lots of financial trouble to manage her daily expenses. So, as there is growing demand for milk in her area, she will use this loan to purchase another cow of an improved variety to add some extra income to her family. Lata says this will help her to save some money for the marriage of her daughter and to provide a better education for her two sons. Lata has a dream of developing a dairy farm in the future and constructing a house.

The other five members of this group are Mira, Sabitri, Subarna, Santa, and Phaguni. They are running a grocery shop, a milk business and growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Maa Devi Shakti Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Devi Shakti Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were all facing the same kind of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs.Kamalini, who was selected as their president. Kamalini is a 35-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children, who are students. The lady standing in the extreme right wearing a white and yellow printed saree, is Kamalini. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc., in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. She has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her general store. Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, sugar, soap, etc. In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in the local community. She is 41 years old, married and has five children. She has been in her business for three years and earns about PHP 250 a day. Right now, Lolita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to buy vegetables such as string beans, onion, squash, and so on. She hopes to obtain her request and increase her income to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as string beans, onion, squash. etc.

loans.name: Savoeurt's Group

texts.en: A resident from a rural area of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia, Savoeurt is a 51-year-old married mother of three kids. In order to secure her family’s finances, she has been growing rice as a primary source of income while her husband catches fish to sell. Savoeurt has been in the business for 30 years, earning approximately KHR 37,000 per day and leaving around KHR 13,000 for her savings, after deducting daily expenses. Savoeurt now needs money to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to use in her farmland. Thus, she is leading a group of three to request a loan with VisionFund. Savoeurt is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund while her two fellow group members are the first-time clients. The previous loans, which have been paid back successfully, has enabled her to buy tractor for use in her rice-farming business. With her new portion of loan, she hopes to gain more yield so that her family’s living condition will improve remarkably.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for farmland.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 54 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a food stall. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Milagros plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Nethale

texts.en: Nethale is married with three children. She is 40 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City. Nethale owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Nethale has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. In the future, Nethale's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Loeng's Group

texts.en: Loeng ,age 47, is residing in the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of six children, four daughters and two sons. One daughter and one son are currently in school while the rest are employed as garment factory workers. To make a living, she farms rice and sells dessert while her husband sells fish. Loeng is leading a group consisting of two members, both of whom are seven-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Loeng has completely paid back the past loans with success and they have enabled her to sustain her business, especially in leasing additional rice farmland. Now, both are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. For Loeng, her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to maximize her yield so as she can maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Lorelee

texts.en: Lorelee lives in Clarin. She has been earning a living through providing transportation services for three years to support the needs of her child. She gets an income of 8,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 31-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy than to see her child successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Lorelee borrows 30,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC just this year. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Heak's Group

texts.en: Heak is a 34-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are still in school. Heak resides in a rural area of Prey Chhor district located in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living through a rice-farming business, which she has been involved in for 17 years. Each day, she earns approximately 16,000 KHR, but she is able to save only around 6,000 KHR, which is considered to be a very little amount of money in a six-member family. Due to unexpected climate change, which sometimes causes natural disasters that provides negative effect to her rice-farming business, she is now leading a group member, Pov, to request a loan of 600,000 KHR each. This will be the first loan for both of them with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to use in her rice field, to cover plowing fees, and to planting vegetables for extra income. Through this loan portion also, she hopes that her children can go as far as possible in terms of education and her current business grows at a fast pace.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Book Djoubo Keur Gallo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Book Djoubo  Keur Gallo regroupe 5 femmes très actives habitants le même village. Elles s’activent les unes dans l’agriculture et les autres dans l’élevage. Leur présidente, la dame Coumba avec son beau sourire, s’active dans le maraichage depuis plus de 30 ans maintenant. Avec le crédit, elle envisage d’acheter des semences oignons, carottes, de l’engrais et du fumier. Elle démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 16 h du soir.
Elle est mariée et son activité lui permet d’appuyer son mari dans les dépenses de la maison.
Avec une augmentation de revenus, il envisage de faire une extension de son activité de maraichage.
texts.en:
The Book Djoubo Keur Gallo loan group has five female members, who are very active and all live in the same village. Some work in agriculture, while others work raising livestock. Their president is called Coumba (pictured with a beautiful smile), and she has worked for more than 30 years in raising cattle. With this loan, she plans to buy onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers, and manure. She starts her working day at 6 in the morning, and finishes at 4 pm.

Coumba is married, and her business allows her to support her husband with the household expenses. With an increase in her income, she plans to extend her market gardening business.

loans.use: To buy onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her business.

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme KALIDJATA est  responsable du groupe BENDIARA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a 07personnes en charge.

Mme gère un secrétariat public (saisie, photocopie) et vend des cartes de recharge depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 04cartons de rame de papier, 05lots de chemise et 05boites de bic (stylo) toute couleur.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son secrétariat, employé plus de personnel et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Kalidjata is in charge of the Bendiara group. She is married, and a mother to four children. The oldest of her children is 23, while the youngest is 14 years of age. They all go to school, and she has seven people under her care.

Kalidjata has managed a business offering secretarial services (typing, photocopying) and selling telephone recharge cards for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in the large market, and her customers are both male and female.

Kalidjata wants to buy four boxes of paper, five batches of shirts and five boxes of pens of assorted colors. With her savings, she wants to improve her business. She plans to expand her secretarial business, employ more people and ensure that her children are educated.

loans.use: To buy four boxes of paper, five batches of shirts and five boxes of pens of assorted colors.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou, âgé de 35 ans fait de la menuiserie aluminium depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant âgé de 2 ans. Il a longtemps voulu faire ce métier depuis le jeune âge. Il vient solliciter pour la 1ère fois un crédit de 500000 F CFA pour acheter une machine de coupure aluminium et diminuer ses charges car il payer pour ce service à d’autres menuisiers qui détiennent cette machine.
Modou commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h du soir. Il reçoit beaucoup de commande du voisinage.
Comme projet futur, il aimerait ouvrir un grand atelier de menuiserie aluminium.
texts.en:
Modou is 35 years of age, and has worked with aluminum for the past 10 years. He is married and a father to a 2-year-old child, and has always wanted to have this job from a very young age. 

Modou has just requested for the first time a loan of 500,000 francs CFA. He plans to buy an aluminum-cutting machine and reduce his charges, as he currently pays other individuals with these machines to carry out this service for him. He starts work at 9 in the morning, finishes at 6 pm, and receives a lot of orders from his neighbors.

In the future, Modou would like to open a large aluminum workshop.

loans.use: To buy an aluminum-cutting machine for his aluminum workshop.

loans.name: Dieu Peut Tout 2 Group

texts.fr: DIEU PEUT TOUT 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Prisca (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Magloire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Prisca et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Prisca a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Prisca vend de la bouillie et du pâté dans son quartier. Prisca exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Prisca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Prisca sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU PEUT TOUT. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Dieu peut tout 2" is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Prisca (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to Magloire. The couple have 3 children, all of whom are, or have been, attending school and one of whom is still dependent on them. Prisca and her husband live together with their children and the couple both take care of the various responsibilities associated with the children.

Prisca left school at primary level. She has been selling porridge and paté in her area for around 12 years. She is passionate about her work, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In pursuit of her customers' satisfaction and in order to increase her working capital, Prisca is requesting a loan, together with the other members of the "Dieu peut tout 2" group. This loan will be used to better respond to their customer demand and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Séraphin

texts.fr: Séraphin est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Séraphin a très peu fréquenté l’école. Séraphin est marié à un certain Madeleine. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il y a un qui n’est pas leur propre enfant. Séraphin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Séraphin mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la couture. Parallèlement à cette activité, Séraphin vend des noix de palme dans sa région. Séraphin s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Séraphin sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Séraphin is 33 years of age, and lives in Benin. He did not attend school for very long, and is now married to a woman called Madeleine. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom are at school. One of these children is not the couple’s own. 

Séraphin lives with his wife and children, and together with his wife ensures that the household expenses are covered. To provide for his family, Séraphin has worked in sewing for about 10 years. He also works selling palm nuts in his region, and buys his supplies in the same region. 

In order to satisfy his customers and expand his sales and income, Séraphin has requested his third loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase his business levels and make more profits. His first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Ayimevo Group

texts.fr: AYIMEVO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Armandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Eric. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Armandine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Armandine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Armandine mène comme activité la vente de tissus, des savons et des plastiques par le système de distribution. Armandine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Armandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Armandine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AYIMEVO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Ayimevo is a group made up of 3 people, whose members lives in the same area of Benin. The group's representative,  Armandine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 25 years old and married to Eric. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school and is dependent on them. Armandine and her husband live together with their children and together they take care of the different responsibilities associated with the children.

Armandine had little schooling. She has been selling fabrics, soaps and plastic items via the distribution system for nearly 10 years. She works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. Armandine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Armandine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Ayimevo. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, soaps and plastic items.

loans.name: Dieu Est Capable Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST CAPABLE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Afiwa Germaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Afiwa Germaine ne vit plus avec son mari et est est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés dont aucun n’est à sa charge. Afiwa Germaine vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Afiwa Germaine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Afiwa Germaine mène comme activité la vente des friperies de façon ambulante. Afiwa Germaine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Afiwa Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiwa Germaine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST CAPABLE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Dieu est capable" is a group composed of 3 people, whose members live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Afiwa Germaine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 30 years old. Afiwa Germaine no longer lives with her husband, and is the mother of 2 children, both of whom have had schooling and neither of whom is dependent on her. She lives alone and is self-sufficient.

Afiwa Germaine did not get much schooling. She has been selling second hand clothing on the street for nearly 15 years. She works very hard, which enables her to meet her needs. Afiwa Germaine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Afiwa Germaine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of "Dieu est capable". This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Iris Judith

texts.es: Iris, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa cruz de Yojoa  junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Iris estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: arroz, manteca, azúcar, huevos, cereales, condimentos, productos enlatados, frijoles, pan, etc. Ella solicita un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos alimenticios y poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su plan es crecer en el negocio y en clientes para obtener ingresos que le permitan ahorrar y lograr terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Iris is 26 years of age, and she lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her husband and four children. She has set up her own grocery store, where she sells basic food items such as rice, lard, sugar, eggs, cereals, seasoning, canned goods, beans, bread, and so on. 

Iris has requested a loan of 25,000 Honduran Lempiras to supply her business with basic products, which will allow her to satisfy her customers’ needs. She plans to expand her business and have more customers, so that she can obtain income to save and finish her home.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sugar, lard, bread, candies, cereals, meats and dairy products to supply her business.

loans.name: Pelaya

texts.es:
Pelaya tiene 62 años, está felizmente casada, ya tiene 30 años de unión con su esposo y ambos viven en la compañía de 3 de sus 6 hijos, con los cuales vive en la casa que heredó hace 37 años. Ella se siente muy feliz, pues toda su vida ha estado trabajando arduamente en las tareas agrícolas, sus años de experiencia en el cultivo de la tierra, le trae satisfacciones porque por más de 32 años ella supo junto a su esposo  sacar provecho a las actividades agrícolas y sus 6 hijos que en su mayoría son hombres y mujeres de bien  han sido sostenidos económicamente con está importante fuente de ingresos, en la actualidad se dedica enteramente al cultivo del maíz, papa, alfalfa y principalmente el trigo  las cuales ella misma se encarga de comercializar para obtener las ganancias. Su gran anhelo es ver a sus 2 últimos hijos terminando sus carreras para lo cual falta aun varios años y esa es la razón de su diario esfuerzo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios.
Pelaya; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Pelaya is 62 years old and has been happily married to her husband for 30 years.  They both live with 3 of their 6 children in the house she inherited 37 years ago.  She feels very happy because she has worked as a farmer her whole life.  Her years of experience in cultivating land brings her satisfaction because, for more than 32 years, she knew how to work with her husband to take advantage of farming activities.  She was able to support her 6 children, who are now almost all men and women, with this important source of income.  Currently, she dedicates herself entirely to growing corn, potatoes, alfalfa and wheat, which she herself sells in order to earn income.

Her great wish is to see her 2 youngest children finish their studies, which is still a few years away and the reason for her daily efforts.  She belongs to the  “My Bank” cooperative and this is her 17th loan with MFP.  She gives thanks to all of you, as she will be able to obtain the loan she needs to meet her objectives.  Likewise, she promises to make her payments on time, as the members of her association are responsible and united.

Pelaya will invest the requested funds into the purchase of various sacks of natural fertilizers for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es: Doña Victoriana, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea de Gracias, Lempira. Hace 15 años que realiza su propia actividad de negocio, vende cosméticos, champú, cremas, lociones, desodorantes mediante catalogo de productos AVON y ARABELLA, y también vende ropa como camisas, camisetas, pantalones y otros que le pidan sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, por pedidos y entrega a domicilio. Este préstamo es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y es por 3,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más producto que le han pedido sus clientes y cumplirles. Asi podra mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su plan es mantener en crecimiento su negocio y que sus hijos estudien y se superen.
texts.en:
Victorina is 48 years of age, is a single mother, and has two children. She lives in a small town in Gracias, Lempira. She started up her own business 15 years ago, and sells cosmetics, shampoo, creams, lotions and deodorants through the Avon and Arabella product catalogs. She also sells clothing such as shirts, t-shirts, pants and other items that her customer request. 

Victorina sells on the street, to order, and via home delivery. This will be her third loan cycle with ODEF, and she has requested 3,000 Honduran Lempiras. She plans to use the money to buy more of the items requested by her customers, so that she can fulfill their orders. In this way Victorina will be able to improve her sales and income, and she plans to continue with her business, ensuring that her children study and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy Avon and Arabella cosmetic products and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Roberto Abilio

texts.es:
Roberto, trabaja en su tienda,  no tiene hijos, vive con su esposa ambos trabajan, no tienen familiares en el extranjero, el negocio lo inicio gracias al apoyo de su esposa quien lo ha apoyado en el negocio, lo tiene ubicado en su casa, no tiene un horario establecido de trabajo, ha adquirido mucha experiencia en su negocio.
Manifiesta que nesecita capital para poder invertir en el negocio, comprando productos de primera necesidad como lo son frijoles, aceite, arroz, queso etc, ya que son muy demandados por la clientela.
La compra le permitirá crecer y tener surtido el negocio para atender de mejor forma a los clientes, lo que el pretende es tener una tienda más grande para que ha futuro sus hijos puedan heredar el mismo oficio.
texts.en:
Roberto works in his store. He has no children and lives with his wife, and they both work. They have no family members living abroad. Roberto started his store thanks to the support of his wife, who has backed him with his business. The business is located in their home, he has no established working hours, and he has acquired a lot of experience with this business.

Roberto says that he needs capital to invest in the business, buying basic goods such as beans, oil, rice, cheese, and so on, as these are in high demand from his customers. These purchases will allow him to grow and supply his business, so that he can better attend to his customers. Roberto plans to have a larger store, so that in the future it can be inherited by his children.

loans.use: To buy beans, oil, rice and cheese.

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.es: Rosalin, de 28 años es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos, en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica desde joven se centró en la fabricación de ladrillos en la fabrica de sus padres, que se ubican en la zona alta del pueblo, donde todas las mañanas se dirige a trabajar en el proceso de fabricación, “tengo que preparar la tierra, luego llenar los moldes, hasta llegar a 25 millares, después los llevo al horno para que se queme a una temperatura máxima, hasta que se encuentren listos”, comenta. Además de mencionar que en temporada de verano tiene que aprovechar al máximo pues solo de esta forma asegura las ganancias del mes. Los ladrillos listos los comercializa en la feria que se desarrolla en la zona, donde tiene clientes fijos que compran cada semana. Ahora desea trabajar al máximo pues como menciona es temporada de verano y tiene que aprovechar al máximo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuestro banco” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, durante todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona perseverante y con muchos ánimos para trabajar y salir adelante. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Rosalin, invertirá el dinero en la compra de toneladas de arena y aserrín para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Rosalin is 28 years of age, and is a humble, hardworking woman. She lives with her parents and siblings in their own house. Since she was a young age, Rosalin’s main business has been focused on the manufacture of bricks in her parents’ factory, which is located in the upper part of the village. Every morning she goes to work on this manufacturing process.  

Rosalin says “I have to prepare the earth, then fill the molds until I have 25,000, before taking them to the kiln to fire them at a maximum temperature until they’re ready”. She also mentions that, during the summer, she has to make the most of her time as this is the only way that she can ensure that she makes enough income each month. Once prepared, the bricks are sold in a local market, where Rosalin has regular customers who buy from her every week. Now she wants to work as much as possible, as she says it’s the summer season and she needs to make the most of her time. 

Rosalin is part of the “Nuestro Banco” (our bank) communal bank, and this is her 12th loan from MFP. Over all this time she has shown herself to be a perseverant person, who really wants to work hard and get ahead in life. This is why she promises to be punctual when repaying her installments. Rosalin wants to invest the money in buying tons of sand and sawdust, which she will use in the brickmaking process.

loans.use: To buy tons of sand and sawdust.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela, de 58 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, con quien cuida de sus 3 hijos en su casa que compró hace 10 años. Tiene 9 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un puesto ubicado en el mercado central de su zona, atiende todas las mañanas hasta el atardecer a su exigente clientela que conocen de la calidad de sus productos, su atención al público es muy cálido y amable; procurando siempre dar un peso exacto y justo a sus productos por lo que ha logrado que sus clientes siempre acudan a consumir los productos que comercializa. Su hija mayor y en algunas ocasiones su esposo, la ayudan pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio, afirma que le agrada atender su negocio  ya que le agrada conversar con otras personas. Además que esta actividad  le ha resultado  beneficiosa en las rentas que le genera. Por ello desea continuar por muchos años en este negocio, con miras a crecer y tener una tienda mayorista de productos de primera necesidad en su misma casa. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Mayela, invertirá el dinero en la compra de arroz, azúcar, menestras y fideos que le servirá para  aumentar la mercadería disponible en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayela, 58 years old, is a woman who is a fighter.  She lives in the company of her husband with whom she cares for 3 children in a house she bought 10 years ago.  She has 9 years of experience in the sale of basic needs products from a locale situated in the central market of her zone.  She tends to her stall every morning until the afternoon, caring for her demanding customers who know the quality of her products.  Her customer service is excellent and friendly and she takes great care to be fair with her products, which is why she has managed for her customers to always visit her to buy the products she carries.  Her oldest daughter and husband sometimes help her but, generally, she is the only one responsible for the business.  She affirms that she enjoys tending to her business because she likes chatting with other people.  In addition, this activity has proven to be beneficial for the profits it generates.  For this reason, she wants to continue with her enterprise for many years and has set her sights on it growing and having a wholesale store with all types of products right in her own home.

She belongs to the “Victorious Women” cooperative bank, and this is her 8th loan with MFP.  She is happy to have financial support, as she has always demonstrated herself to be very responsible with her payments.  In addition, she likes being part of a community bank because all the members are responsible and unified people.

Mayela will invest the money into the purchase of rice, sugar, mixed vegetables and noodles that will serve her to augment the merchandise available in her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, mixed vegetables and noodles.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: La señora Adela, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en Choloma Cortes. Ella tiene 16 años de haber establecido su propio negocio en un establecimiento del mercado local, donde vende todo tipo de materiales para la confección de ropa como ser: hilos, encajes, botones, lana, cintas, agujas etc. también vende materiales para la elaboración de piñatas. Desde joven le ha gustado esta actividad y su negocio ha estado en crecimiento. Ha mantenido 10 ciclos de préstamos con el actual y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con esta inversión va incrementar el inventario en materiales para la confección de ropa y para la elaboración de piñatas. Ella quiere que su negocio siga mejorando las ventas y sus ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos a graduarse y también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adela is 39 years of age, married with three children, and lives in Choloma Cortes. She set up her own business 16 years ago in an establishment in the local market, where she sells all kinds of dressmaking materials such as thread, lace, buttons, wool, ribbon, needles, etc. She also sells materials for making piñatas. From a very young age she liked this kind of work, and her business has grown. 

Adela has had 10 loan cycles including this one, which is for 10,000 Honduran Lempiras. With this investment she wants to increase her inventory of dressmaking and piñata-making materials. She wants her business sales to keep increasing, so that she can help her children graduate and also improve her home.

loans.use: To supply her business with dressmaking materials, such as thread, lace, ribbon and needles, as well as materials to make piñatas for sale.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia, de 58 años es una mujer trabajadora, cuida de su hijo Diofer con quien vive en la casa de su hermana desde que nació. Se siente dichosa, pues su hijo es todo un profesional y ahora trabaja. “Me ayuda es muy bueno”, comenta. Gracias a la fábrica de ladrillos que tiene, pudo sacar adelante a su hijo, ya tiene 30 años dedicándose a esto. Cuenta que le ayuda peones, quienes contrata para trabajar junto a ella, al mes hace una hornada que consta de 25 millares de ladrillos, los cuales traslada en camión a la feria que se realiza todas las semanas en la zona principal de ese producto en la ciudad. Ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, tanto así que ahora espera aumentar la cantidad que ladrillos que ase al mes, para ello quiere contratar más personal. Lo que más le gusta es recoger leña para quemar los moldes de arcilla que realiza, cuenta que es divertido, pues camina en el campo, su lugar preferido. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Dionicia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de arena, aserrín y el pago a los peones que le ayudan en la elaboración de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 58 years of age, is a very hard-working woman.  She cares for her son Diofer, with whom she has lived in her sister’s house since he was born.  She feels fortunate because her son is a professional and now working.  “He helps me and is very good”, she comments.  Thanks to the brick factory she has, she was able to help her son get ahead; she has dedicated herself to this work for 30 years.  She has the help of laborers, who she hires to work with her.  She makes a batch of 25 thousand bricks every month, which she transports by truck to the market that takes place every week in the primary zone of the city for this type of product.  There, she obtains good earnings and, so much so, that she hopes to increase the number of bricks she makes every month by contracting more personnel.  What she enjoys most is collecting wood for burning the clay molds that she makes.  She tells us that it’s fun since she walks in the countryside, her favorite place.  

She belongs to the “My Bank” cooperative bank and this loan will be her 5th with MFP.  She thanks all of you for your support, given she will obtain the funds necessary to meet her objectives.  In addition, she promises to make her loan payments on time, as the members of the association are responsible and unified.

Dionicia will invest the funds she is requesting into the purchase of sand, sawdust and paying the laborers who will help her make the bricks.

loans.use: to buy sand, sawdust and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Edilson Vladimir

texts.es:
Edilson, necesita invertir en su negocio de granja porqueriza, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar otro crédito para comprar cerdos engordarlos y luego venderlos.
Declara que el crédito anterior surgió efectos muy importantes, le permitió crecer en la ganaderia, tener todo lo necesario para tener mejores resultados en sus ganancias, la vida le ha cambiado, hoy dia quiere invertir en el negocio de los cerdos, las condiciones económicas son muy buenas, la familia vive mejor que antes.
texts.en:
Edilson needs to invest in his pig-farming business. This is why he has requested another loan, so that he can buy pigs which he will fatten and then sell.

Edilson says that his last loan had a very important impact, as it allowed him to buy more livestock, as well as to have all he needed to have better profits. His life has changed, and today he would like to invest in his pig-farming business. His financial conditions are very good, and his family’s life is now better than it ever was before.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Abahetsi Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne est le membre et la présidente du groupe Abahetsi. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres responsable dans leurs activités ».Elle a 28 ans et elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 6 mois  à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Elle a une personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jeanne est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, elle planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être la meilleure agricultrice dans la région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member as well as being the president of the Abahetsi group. The name of the group means "members who are responsible in their activities". She is 28 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 months old and six; one of the children goes to school. She has one other dependent. Jeanne has six years of primary education and is a rice farmer. This is her third loan cycle with ACB and she is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs relating to her rice farming activity.

In order to expand her rice farming activity she is planning to ask for other loans so that she can increase her rice cultivation. In the coming years she would like to be the best farmer in her region. With the profits she makes she is planning to pay for her children's schooling and health costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for her rice farming.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 60 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Primitiva y sus hijos en la casa que compró hace 16 años. El principal ingreso económico que tiene es la compra y venta de animales, es decir por más de 30 años dedicó sus esfuerzos al cuidado de animales entre ellos ovejas y vacas, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y paciencia, ya que depende mucho de ello que puedan madurar y ofrecer la mejor carne. Cuando los animales se encuentran listos, Alejandro vende su carne al mercado de carnes de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes fijos que siempre comercializan con él. Asimismo comenta que depende mucho de la temporada pues hay meses en los que el precio de los animales son menores y es en ese momento en que compra mayor cantidad para obtener a largo plazo ganancias prosperas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuestro banco” y este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, durante todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona perseverante y con muchos ánimos para trabajar y salir adelante. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Alejandro, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas y si el dinero le alcanza podrá también comprar una vaca.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 60 years old. He is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife Primitiva and their children in the house he bought 16 years ago. His main income source is buying and selling animals. That is, for more than 30 yeara he has worked taking care of animals, among them sheep and cows. He takes good care of them with patience and dedication, because that is what is needed for them to mature and offer the best meat. When the animals are ready, Alejandro sells the meat in the city meat markets, where he has regular customers who always buy from him. He says that it depends a lot of the season because there are months when the prices for the animals are low and that is when he buys larger quantities to have good earnings long term. He belongs to the “Nuestro Banco” communal bank and this is his 17th loan with MFP. He has always shown himself to be a person who perservers who really wants to work and get ahead. That is why he promises to be make his payments on time.  

Alejandro will invest the money he has asked for in buying sheep and if there is enough money he wll also buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and a cow

loans.name: Dagbégnon Sylvestre

texts.fr: Dagbégnon Sylvestre est âgé de 53 ans et vit au Bénin. Dagbégnon Sylvestre a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Dagbégnon Sylvestre est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeannette. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il y a un qui n’est pas leur propre enfant. Dagbégnon Sylvestre vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Dagbégnon Sylvestre mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, la menuiserie. Parallèlement à cette activité, Dagbégnon Sylvestre vend des bois dans sa région. Dagbégnon Sylvestre s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dagbégnon Sylvestre sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dagbégnon Sylvestre is 53 years old and lives in Benin. He attended school until secondary level. Dagbégnon Sylvestre is married to a merchant called Jeannette. The couple have 4 dependent children who all go to school. One of the children is not their biological child. Dagbégnon Sylvestre lives together with his wife and children and, together with his wife, takes care of the household responsibilities.

In order to be able to cover the various family expenses, Dagbégnon Sylvestre has been working as a carpenter for around 30 years. He also sells wood in his region. He gets his supplies in the area. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, and to increase his turnover and profit, Dagbégnon Sylvestre is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the 3rd time. This loan will definitely allow him to increase his level of business and to earn more profits. The 2 first loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Métoche

texts.fr: Métoche est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Agboïnou. Métoche est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants à charge. Métoche n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Métoche vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Métoche vend depuis vingt ans, des vins de palme, de la nourriture et des boissons dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Métoche s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Métoche sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Métoche is 44 years old and married to Agboïnou. She is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are attending school and dependent on the couple. As well as their own children, the couple are also responsible for 3 other children. Métoche did not go to school. She lives together with her husband and children and, together with her husband, takes care of the household's various needs.

In order to be able to contribute to those different needs, Métoche has been selling palm oil, food and drinks in her district for 20 years. This business allows her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. She gets her supplies in her area. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, and to increase her turnover and revenue, Métoche is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the 5th time. This loan will enable her to increase her level of business, her customer numbers and her revenue. The first 4 loan have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm wine.

loans.name: Dansou Nestor

texts.fr: Dansou Nestor est âgé de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Dansou Nestor a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Dansou Nestor est marié à une marchande du nom de Marguerite. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Dansou Nestor vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Dansou Nestor mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la photographie. Parallèlement à cette activité, Dansou Nestor vend des cassettes et des pellicules dans son atelier. Dansou Nestor s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dansou Nestor sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dansou Nestor is 46 years old and lives in Benin. He attended school until primary level. Dansou Nestor is married to a merchant called Marguerite. The couple have 6 dependent children, all of whom attend school. Dansou Nestor lives together with his wife and children and, together with his wife, takes care of the household responsibilities.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Dansou Nestor has been working in photography for about 20 years. He also sells cassettes and film in his workshop. He gets his supplies in his area. In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase his turnover and revenue, Dansou Nestor is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the 4th time. This loan will certainly enable him to increase his business levels and to earn more profits. The first 3 loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cassettes and film.

loans.name: Abesamihigo B Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Athanase est le membre et le président du groupe Abesamihigo B. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres des performances».Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 7 ans à 26 ans,dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire, de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Athanase is a member of the Abesamihigo B group, as well as being its president. The name of the group means "People who achieve". He is 52 years old and married with six children between the ages of seven and 26 years old, five whom go to school. He has six years of primary education.

Athanase is a rice farmer and this is his third loan cycle with ACB. He says that his previous loan helped his farming activities significantly and that he did not encounter any difficulties in repaying his loan. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay labor costs relating to his rice farming activity.

He is planning to ask for other loans so that he can expand his rice farming activity. In the coming years he would like to become the most significant rice producer in the region. With the profits he makes he is planning to pay for his children's schooling .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
“Hace 10 años inicie vendiendo arroz de leche luego comencé a vender pocos productos con encargo” menciono Marielena de 27 años. En la actualidad ella se dedica al comercio de productos varios desde ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas…etc. y su principal meta es aumentar el negocio.
Con el crédito anterior logro comprar tres quintales de hierro para mejorar la vivienda.
Las otras integrantes de este grupo son Mercedes de Socorro quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y Nohemi quien también vende ropa.
texts.en:
“10 years ago I started selling rice pudding. Later I started selling a few products by order." says Marielena, 27. Now she sells various products, including clothes, shoes, perfume, cream, etc. Her main goal is to grow her business.

With the previous loan, she was able to buy 600 kilos of iron rods to do some home improvement. 

The othe rmembers of this group are Mercedes de Socorro, who sells clothes, and Nohemi, who also sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasol lo conforman cinco personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Emilia quien tiene desde hace 20 años una refresquería, en la cual colaboran con ella cuatro personas. El crédito lo invertirá en productos para el tramo.

Los otros integrantes son Jorge de 42 años quien tiene una sastrería desde hace 30 años, Sugey de 31 años vende cosméticos y María Elena vende pizza, productos AVON y BOGUE, y Nohemí tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The Girasol group is made up of five hardworking people. One of them is Rosa Emilia, who has sold beverages for 20 years. Four people work with her. She will invest the loan in products for her work.

The other members are Jorge,42, who has been a tailor for 30 years. Sugey, 31, sells cosmetics, and María Elena sells pizza, Avon and Bogue products, and Nohemí has had a small store for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, cups, bags, etc.

loans.name: Panama Group

texts.es:
El grupo Panamá lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Malva quien es propietaria de una farmacia. Este negocio tiene 18 años pero ella lo adquirió hace 4 años ya que cuando murió la dueña ella lo adquirió. Cabe mencionar que  ella trabajaba en dicho negocio.

El crédito lo invertirá en productos médicos.
Las otras integrantes son Adriana quien vende ropa y zapatos desde hace 3 años y Linda Ruth quien vende bisutería y artesanías en Masaya desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Panamá group is comprised of three hard-working entrepreneurs, one of whom is Malva, the owner of a pharmacy.  The business is 18 years old although she acquired it four years ago when the previous owner died.  It is worth mentioning that she used to work at the pharmacy.

The loan will be used to buy medical products.  

The other members of the group are Adriana, who has been selling clothing and shoes for three years, and Linda Ruth, who sells jewelry and handicrafts in Masaya and has been in business for four years.

loans.use: To buy medical products.

loans.name: Olatoundji Augustin

texts.fr: Olatoundji Augustin est âgé de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Olatoundji Augustin est marié à une marchande du nom de Rachelle. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge. Olatoundji Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Olatoundji Augustin mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la peinture des automobiles dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Olatoundji Augustin vend des peintures, papiers verts, vernis, polyseur. Olatoundji Augustin s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Olatoundji Augustin sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Olatoundji Augustin is 42 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant called Rachelle. The couple has three children in its care. Olatoundji Augustin lives with his wife and children, and together with his wife covers all the household expenses. In order to cover all his family's costs, he has for the past ten years been painting cars in his region. At the same time, he sells paints, sandpaper, varnishes and polishes. Olatoundji Augustin gets his supplies in a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing both his turnover and income, he is requesting a third loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow him to expand his business and make more money. The first two loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy paints, sandpaper, varnish and polishes.

loans.name: Adjobignon Fabien

texts.fr: Adjobignon Fabien est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Adjobignon Fabien a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Adjobignon Fabien est marié à une couturière du nom de Marie. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Adjobignon Fabien vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adjobignon Fabien mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la photographie dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjobignon Fabien vend des fournitures de photographe à son domicile. Adjobignon Fabien s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adjobignon Fabien sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Adjobignon Fabien is 34 years of age and lives in Benin. He went to high school and is married to a seamstress called Marie. The couple has three dependent children, some of whom are at school, and only two of whom are their own children. Adjobignon Fabien lives with his wife and children and, together with Marie, ensures that the various household expenses are met. To do so, Adjobignon Fabien has worked as a photographer in his workshop for about 10 years. In addition to this business, he also works selling photography supplies from home, and gets his own supplies in the region where he lives. 

To ensure customer satisfaction and increase his sales and income, Adjobignon Fabien has asked for a second loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase his business activity, and to make more profit. His first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy photography supplies.

loans.name: Sokan Julienne

texts.fr: Sokan Julienne est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un marchand du nom de Chakirou. Sokan Julienne a un enfant à charge, qui ne fréquente pas. Sokan Julienne a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Sokan Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Sokan Julienne exerce depuis treize ans, la coiffure dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sokan Julienne vend des mèches et divers articles. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Sokan Julienne s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sokan Julienne sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sokan Julienne is 37 years old and married to a merchant called Chakirou. She has one child in her care who does not go to school. Sokan Julienne went to primary school only. She lives with her husband and children, and together with her husband provides for the various household needs. In order to provide for these various needs, she has for the past 13 years been doing hairdressing in her workshop. At the same time she sells hair extensions and various other articles. This business enables her to provide without any great difficulty for her needs. Sokan Julienne gets her supplies in her region and in a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing both her turnover and income, she is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her customer base and her income. The three previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and various items.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42 años de edad,  vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido  y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, entre otros. Luis es un hombre muy trabajador, con muchos deseos de salir adelante cada día por el bien de su familia a quien ama muchísimo y a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo.

Día a día Luis trabaja n su pequeño negocio de venta de gas domestico, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque sus clientes ya lo conoce ya que tiene su negocio desde hace 2 años y también porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más balones de gas para su negocio, de esta manera podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y sobre todo porque mejorara sus ingresos; así el seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, lives in the city of Ica which is known for its warm, welcoming climate, and its agriculture, especially for crops such as asparagus, grapes, cotton and others.  Luis is a very hard worker who is determined to get ahead for his family, which he loves very much and provides an income for through his work.

Every day Luis works in his small domestic gas business.  He spends about ten hours a day with up to 20 customers and believes business is going well because the customers have known him for two years and he is kind to them.  

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy gas cyclinders for his business.  This means he will be able to give his customers better customer service so he can improve his income.  He will continue working hard on a daily basis to carry out his dream of:  "Giving his parents a better quality of life".

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Isabelle Sèhoué

texts.fr: Isabelle Sèhoué est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un certain Parfait. Isabelle Sèhoué est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Parmi les enfants, trois ne sont pas leurs propres enfants. Isabelle Sèhoué a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Isabelle Sèhoué vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Isabelle Sèhoué exerce depuis vingt ans, la coiffure à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Isabelle Sèhoué vend des mèches et divers articles. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Isabelle Sèhoué s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Isabelle Sèhoué sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Isabelle Sèhoué is 45 years old and is married to a man named Parfait. She has 4 children--3 of which are not her own. She attended school until junior high, and some of her children have [also] had schooling. All of the children are still under her and her husband's care. Isabelle Sèhoué lives with her husband and children, and the couple together provides for their household needs.

Isabelle Sèhoué has been working out of her home as a hairdresser for 20 years. She also sells hair extensions and other goods. This business allows her to meet the needs of her family without much difficulty. 

Isabelle Sèhoué procures her supplies from around the area. In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase turnover and income, she is requesting her fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to raise the level of her business, increase her number of customers, and earn more income. Her three previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and other goods

loans.name: Dora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dora del Carmen de cuarenta y ocho años de edad tiene una hija y vive junto a su hermana. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal lociones, cosméticos, cremas entre otros, adicional a eso también se dedica a la costura con lo que complementa los gastos del hogar, tiene mucho tiempo con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas y en la costura, es muy conocida en la zona y ya posee mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Dora es una mujer dedicada a su labor, todos los días se levanta con la esperanza de superarse pues quiere un futuro prospero, sabe que solo con su esfuerzo y dedicación logrará el éxito y no se rendirá hasta alcanzarlo, en los últimos meses aumento su demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, lociones, cosméticos y tela por mayor. Dora del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora del Carmen, 48, has a daughter and lives with her sister.  She sells personal care products such as lotions, cosmetics, creams and other items.  She also works as a seamstress to help cover household expenses and has been in business for quite some time, which has given her much experience in sales and sewing.  She is very well-known in the area and has many customers because of the quality of her products, good prices and excellent service.

Dora is dedicated to her work.  Every day she gets up with the hope of improving her situation and working toward a prosperous future.  She knows that only with effort and dedication she will be successful, and will not give up until she makes it.  Over the last few months demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this by increasing her investment.  She does not have sufficient capital and therefore is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy creams, lotions, cosmetics and fabric wholesale.  Dora del Carmen has a good credit record and is very responsible.  She promises to pay the loan back on time, while offering her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella posee una pequeña panadería muy conocida en la localidad, elabora pan en variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, pastelitos, semita, tortas entre otros, tiene muchos años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite elaborar el pan mas delicioso y de mejor calidad de toda la zona, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por el excelente servicio y los precios accesibles; Elvia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su trabajo, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar un futuro mejor y no descansara hasta lograr su mas grande meta, como toda buena comerciante quiere ampliar el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, huevos, azúcar, dulce, levadura, etc. Elvia tiene muy buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Elvia, 64, lives with her family in her own house.  She has a small bakery business that is very well-known in the community.  She makes both savory and sweet bread, cheese tortillas, pastries, cakes and other products and has several years experience in making the most delicious, quality bread in all the area.  She has many customers, as people prefer her excellent service and low prices.

Elvia is an entrepreneur who is dedicated to her work.  She is always looking for alternatives to give her a better future, and will not rest until she reaches her goal.  Like all good merchants, she wants to expand her business but is in need of capital.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy flour, eggs, sugar, sweets, yeast, etc.  Elvia has good credit references and promises to pay back the loan.  She is also confident she can provide economic security for her household.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sugar, sweets and yeast.

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! 

Les  presento a Paulo de 18 años,  Paulo estudia mecánica automotriz  en un instituto, eligió esta carrera por que le gustan los carros, solo le falta 01 año para terminar sus estudios;  en la actualidad está realizando sus prácticas en un taller esto  le permite adquirir experiencia para su carrera. En el futuro  Paulo quiere tener su propio taller de mecánica, su préstamo le servirá para la compra de los componentes para armar  un motor, que será parte del examen para su titulación, Paulo considera que su préstamo es una gran ayuda  sin él no hubiera podido lograr sus objetivos, este es su segundo préstamo con el primero pudo comprar su computadora que le ayudo mucho en la parte académica.
Paulo  quiere agradecer a  los inversionistas Kiva: “Muchas gracias porque me abren las puertas al éxito!”
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

I introduce you to Paulo, 18, who is studying automotive mechanics at an institute.  He chose this profession because he likes cars; he will finish his studies in just one year.  Currently, he is working as a student in a workshop to gain experience for his career.  In the future, Paulo wants to have his own auto repair workshop.  His loan will be used to buy components for the engine he will build as part of his degree exam.  Paulo believes the loan will be very helpful, and without it he would not be able to meet his goal.  This is his second loan.  He used the first one to buy a computer to help with the academic part of his education.

Paulo is grateful to Kiva lenders:  "Many thanks for opening the door to success for me!"

loans.use: To buy an engine for his degree exam.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married and has three children. She is 46 years old and resides in Segatic Daku, Clarin. Narcisa owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living, and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Narcisa joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is businessman. Gulruhsor is a teacher at the number 34 school in her region. She has a lot of pupils and tries to teach them with all the knowledge she has. 

She lives with her husband and 2 children in a house that is in bad condition. Her house is old and was built many years ago and it needs some repairs. In winter it has too much heat loss through windows and doors due to the damages to them. 

She needs about 2,500 somoni to cover the cost of new windows and doors, as well covering the costs of hired workers. Gulruhsor and her family await your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, cement and paint for repairing her house.

loans.name: Vanthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Vanthoeurn, aged 33, is a villager from a rural area of the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent sons, who are either helping with the family’s business or are still in school.  She is a teacher at a local school in the community and also a rice farmer. Her husband assists her in making more income through working for others for a fee besides helping her with the rice field. 

She can earn about 27,000 KHR per day from the current business in which she has been engaged for almost 10 years. Her main challenge is the unpredictable weather issue, whether drought or flood, which decrease her yields. 

Vanthoeurn is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped her to better support her family, mainly to buy decent food for her children. Now she is leading her group members. As group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She expects to gain high production so as to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is a 33-year-old mother of six children and lives in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. To provide the daily basic needs for her household, she does rice farming on six hectares of farmland. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver in order to supplement their income. 

Sambath is now leading a group of two. Both are eighth-cycle borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She has wisely used her loans in order to support her business timely and to relieve her family’s burden. She has completely paid back the entire past loans already. 

Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group leader, her portion will be used to buy four sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds for her paddy field. She hopes to boost more production of her cash crop so she can set aside some money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, de 36 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Manuela y sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en un casa alquilada hace 2 años. De lunes a viernes durante las mañanas Mario, dedica su tiempo al trabajo de albañil, le va muy bien pues nunca la falta contratos para la fabricación de casas. Ya por las tardes, continua trabajando, pues desea sacar adelante a sus hijos. La motocarro que adquirió le sirve para trasportar a las personas que viven en los alrededores de la ciudad, “en las tardes hay más movimiento, por ello trabajo durante esa hora”, menciona. Más los fines de semana, sábados y domingos trabaja todo el día, ya que hay afluencia de personas por la feria ganadera y de alimentos que se realiza en la ciudad. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, su secreto es mantener su vehículo siempre en buenas condiciones, “además de cuidar, cada año de uso vendo la motocarro para comprar una nueva, de esta manera no se devalúa ni malogra”, afirma. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Mario, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de mantenimiento de su motocarro. De esa forma continuará trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Mario is 36 years old and is a hard worker. He lives with his wife, Manuaela, and their four children in a house that they have rented for 2 years. From Monday to Friday in the mornings Mario spends his time working as a bricklayer. This is going very well because he never lacks contracts for building houses. Currently during the afternoons he continues working because he wants to help his children get ahead. Mario has a motorcycle which he uses to transport people who live in the outskirts of the city. He says, “In the afternoons there is more movement, so I work during this time.”  In addition, during the weekend he works all day Saturday and Sunday since there are a lot of people going to the livestock and food market which takes place in the city. He already has 10 years of experience in this business. His secret is to always keep his vehicle in the best conditions. “Besides taking care of it, I sell the motorcycle each year in order to buy a new one. This way it never devalues or stops working,” Mario says. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He appreciates their support and that he can continue to invest in the progress of his business.  He also promises to be on time with his payments. Mario will invest the money he is asking for to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle. This way he will be able to continue working without worries.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, a 60-year-old married mother originally from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, is a mother of seven children. For daily basic needs, she has been growing rice for 30 years as the primary source of income. She also uses her spare time in planting water convolvulus (water spinach) and working for others for a fee to increase her income. 

It is quite challenging for her as there is not enough rainfall for supporting her rice cropping. Kim has taken loans from VisionFund four times and has smartly used her loan to maintain good progress in her business and her household, and her loans have been paid back consecutively. 

Now, she is the leader of her group which consists of five members. She and another two fellow group members are applying for 400,000 KHR each, while the remaining two members are seeking 200,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to buy four sacks of fertilizers. She hopes that this purchase will boost her yield so she can multiply her income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Zolboohuu

texts.en:
Mr. Zolboohuu, who is 44 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the province of Arhangai. His wife, who is 23, works as an assistant instructor and earns a salary of 400,000 MNT. Their oldest daughter is a college student and the other children go to a secondary school. 

Mr. Zolboohuu operates a goods transportation business with a Russian truck in the countryside. Now he is running a public transportation business with a Russian micro bus.
