loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising chickens. Evangeline aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, trabaja con una tienda;  pero ha visto la necesidad de invertir para surtirla, es por ello que decidió solicitar un  crédito, lo necesita para abastecer su tienda comprando productos tales como: detergentes. cereales, carnes, bebidas refrescantes, boquitas, toallas desechables, papel higiénico.
Nos manifiesta que el crédito anterior tuvo efectos positivos ya que le permitió vender más, para el sustento de su familia, pagar las deudas y gastos, y la salud, la situación del hogar ha cambiado desde que solicito su primer crédito y poco a poco va saliendo con sus deudas y generando ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Graciela works in a small store. She has seen the need to restock her store, which is why she has requested a loan. She needs it to restock her store, to buy products like: soaps, cereals, meat, refreshing drinks, snacks, napkins and toilet paper.

She told us that the previous loan had positive results, because it allowed her to sell more, to help sustain the family by paying their debts and covering household and health expenses. The household situation has changed since she requested her first loan and little by little she is paying off her debts and generating income to cover the needs of the home.

loans.use: to buy soaps, cereals, meat and refreshing drinks.

loans.name: Tofioaiga

texts.en:
Tofioaiga is a 28-year-old woman who is married and has 3 children. She has a small business which is a cattle farm. She has been with this business for 3 years.

Tofioaiga needs a loan to buy a roll of barbed wire, nails, a wheelbarrow, a pair of gloves, and more calves. She will use her profits to help her business improve and pay for her kids' education.  Tofioaiga joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.  Elizabeth requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, se dedica a la  crianza de ganado, ha solicitado otro crédito para fortalecer el negocio y comprar cuatro terneros para cuidarlos  y luego revenderlos después de seis meses, el costo de cada ternero anda aproximadamente en un costo de $250.00 dólares c/u, espera con el prestamo poder cubrir la mayor parte de la inversion.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior, resulto ser de mucha ayuda, por que compro un terreno donde actualmente vive y que todas las demás condiciones se mantienen.
texts.en:
Adelina raises cattle. She has requested another loan, this time to strengthen her business and buy four calves to care for and then re-sell after six months. The cost of each calf is approximately $250.00. She expects the loan to cover the greatest part of the investment. 

She notes that the previous loan was very helpful because she bought the land where she now lives and was able to get by with her other expenses.

loans.use: to purchase four calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, pork, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and married with one child. For the past seven years, she has raised pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Irene is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, necesita seguir adelante con su trabajo agricola, pero su capacidad financiera no se lo permite, nos solicita otro crédito para seguir con su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, necesita invertir en insumos  tales como: fertilizantes para cultivar granos básicos, compra de ocho sacos de abono y pagar el alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno donde cultivar.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior resulto muy útil obtuvo mayor resultados en la cosecha gracias a ese crédito hoy tiene mayor capacidad de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis needs to continue with his farm work, but he does not have the financial capacity to do so. He is requesting another loan so that he can continue growing basic grains. Luis needs to invest in supplies such as fertilizers for cultivating basic grains, eight sacks of compost, and to pay the rent on two plots of farmland that he will use for cultivation.

Luis says that his previous loan was very useful. He achieved better results with his harvest thanks to that loan. Now he has greater income capacity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 37 years old and is married to a fisherman. The couple has seven school-going children, all of whom  live at home. For the past five years, Mbeyu has run a home-based business selling chickens and her children help her with her work. She has a kiosk in her compound and now has established customers.  

Mbeyu is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She can get a better price for larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, frijoles, arroz, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además  del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Ana es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchas metas por delante, esta dispuesta a esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que solo así podrá cumplir sus sueños y llegar al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar nuevas inversiones pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Ana Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita, 43 years old, lives with her life companion and son. She has a store where she sells basic supplies, beans, rice, bread, instant food products and soap, among other items. She has had the business for several years and this has given her valuable experience in sales that enables her to earn better profits.

The business is located in her house and is very well known. She has many customers since people prefer her because everything she sells is of the highest quality and at the most accessible prices. Her service is also unparalleled: she is at the disposal of her customers.

Ana is an energetic and hardworking woman who is eager to get ahead. She is ready to work to the fullest because she knows that is the only way to fulfill her dreams and achieve success. Like all good merchants she wants to grow her business and make new investments however she does not have enough capital. Therefore she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable her to purchase basic grains, bread, sweets, instant foods, drinks, soap, etc. Ana Margarita has a good credit history. She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt and is confident that she will be able to provide financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, such as bread, sweets, instant food products, drinks and soap.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. For the past 25 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Josephine is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 28-year-old married woman supporting her husband, who works as a tailor. They have two sons. Fatmeh uses her artistic talent to make baskets from straw and plastic flowers. She has applied for this loan to buy more raw materials for making baskets. This will allow her to increase her productivity so that she can participate in upcoming handcrafts events.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Janvier Thomas

texts.fr: Monsieur Janvier Thomas est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il est peintre de profession et capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine.  Néanmoins  parallèlement  il pratique le commerce et la vente de tissus pour renforcer ses revenus périodiques. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour acheter des tissus a revendre. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux supporter les charges quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Janvier Thomas is a married man who lives in Senegal. He is a painter by profession, with five years of experience in his field. However, in order to earn a secondary source of reliable income, Janvier Thomas is also involved in the resale of fabric.

He is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and has already successfully repaid three prior loans. He is currently requesting a loan of 150,000 XOF so that he can purchase fabric for resale. The resulting increase in his income will help Janvier Thomas to better support his family and to pay for their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for resale.

loans.name: Sara Guadalupe

texts.es: Sara Guadalupe de veintiuno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de tres años; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tiene en variedad camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, entre otros,  tiene mas de catorce años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, ella tiene su venta en un lugar muy estratégico muy concurrido de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precio accesible y con un servicio excelente; Sara es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, todos los días se levanta con la disposición de luchar por un futuro mas  prospero pues sabe que solo así tendrá éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda  y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Sara Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Guadalupe, age 21, lives with her life companion and her three year old son.  She buys and sells women’s and men’s clothes.  She has a variety of shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and more.  She has had her business for over 14 years, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience.  This allows her to get very good income.

She sells in a very strategic place that is very busy.  She has obtained a lot of clientele.  They prefer her because she always has what they need, a quality product at a reasonable price.  She also provides excellent service.  

Sara is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her work.  She gets up every day with the inclination to strive for a more prosperous future.  She knows that it is only this way that she will be successful.

In the past weeks demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy clothes wholesale.

Sara Guadalupe has good references, and she is very responsible.  She affirms that she will be able to repay the loan and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es: MARIA TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE,TRABAJADORA Y DEDICADA A SU FAMILIA. ELLA TRABAJA POR SU PROPIA CUENTA REALIZANDO LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALAGO Y ROPA SOBRE PEDIDO. TIENE VARIOS AÑOS DEDICANDOSE A ESTE NEGOCIO Y EXPRESA QUE LE VA MUY BIEN, PUES CON EL TIEMPO HA LOGRADO MANTENER A SUS CLIENTES Y SUS VENTAS LE HAN AYUDADO A CUBRIR SU NECESIDADES. GRACIAS A LA DEMANDA QUE TIENE EN SU NEGOCIO, MARIA REQUIERE DE UNA INVERSION QUE LE PERMITA REALIZAR EL PEDIDO DE MAS MERCANCIA DE ZAPATOS Y ROPA, PARA ASI PODER MANTENER A SUS CLIENTES SATISFECHOS Y SUS VENTAS MEJOREN CON DICHA INVERSION. POR TAL MOTIVO SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR A CABO ESTA COMPRA Y ASI HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and is a very hard working and responsible person, who is very dedicated to her family. She works freelance selling shoes from catalogs and clothing by request. She has been working in this business for various years and she says it is going very well. During the time she has had the business she has succeeded in maintaining her customer base and her sales have helped her to cover her necessities. Thanks to the demand there is for her products, Maria needs additional funds to be able to purchase more merchandise of shoes and clothing, so that her customers will remain satisfied and so that her sales will improve as a result of her investment. This is why she has requested a loan, to be able to be able to make this purchase and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, she has operated a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Judith earns additional income from farming sugarcane and operating a motorcycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans through NWTF.

Judith is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
This is Ricky. He previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures. 
 
Ricky is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy scrap materials. He will incorporate his loan into his current revolving fund that he uses to buy materials. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. Ricky looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He hopes to grow his business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for his family. Ricky faithfully meets up weekly with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy scrap and junk items such as plastics, cans, bottles, papers, and cartons to resell

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes's group is comprised of  hard-working women. Agnes is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es: Elsa Beatriz de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta lo cual le permite siempre obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es mu transitado de personas y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo esta elaborado con materia prima de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Elsa es una mujer emprendedora, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en su labor pues sabe que solo así logrará el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción, necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Elsa Beatriz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Elsa Beatriz is 29 years old and lives with her life's companion and their children. She makes and sells tortillas. Elsa has dedicated various years to this business and it has given her much experience in sales, allowing her to always obtain the best earnings. The place where Elsa sells her tortillas is much transited and she has a lot of customers. People prefer her tortillas because she works with first-quality primary materials and offers accessible prices as well as good service.

Elsa is an active and enterprising woman with lots of desire to get ahead. Every day she pushes herself to work to the maximum; Elsa understands that only in this way will she succeed. In the last few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage by increasing production. Consequently, she had to request a loan from INTEGRAL that would permit her to buy corn at wholesale. Elsa has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures us that she can cover the debt and, at the same time, Elsa hopes to provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: buy corn at wholesale for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and a single parent with one child. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, Anita has run a business cooking and selling food. She earns 6,000 PHP each month and joined GDMP in 2011.

Anita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of giving her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 27 years old and married to Marlon, a tricyle driver. Their income comes from providing transport services to people in their village. Her spouse has been doing this for five years now. They have a child who is still in elementary school. 

The couple hopes to earn income for their child's education, so Jenalyn is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle. This will help them provide service and earn income from it. Jenalyn also prays for safe travel for her husband and all their passengers too. The couple aims to have a stable income so they will achieve a fortunate life someday.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for their motorcycle.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 26-year-old married man living in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. To earn an income he sells bananas, which he has done for five years. He usually gets 5,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Eric is able to buy more bananas to sell. He joined GDMPC just this year. Someday, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of the tricycle. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her tricycle and additional items for her tailoring business and store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, sausages, dairy products, staple grains and drinks for her food stand.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta Alicia de 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos quienes gracias al esfuerzo de su madre cuentan con todo lo necesario para vivir. Berta posee una venta de verduras la cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su municipio, en donde ya cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a este oficio, logrando ser muy conocida en la zona lo que le ha dado la oportunidad de tener varios clientes fijos. Berta solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras lo que le de la ventaja de comprar a precios un poco más bajos y de esta forma obtener más ganancias, lo cual es su objetivo principal.
texts.en:
Berta Alicia is 41 years old and is a single mother of two young children.  Thanks to her efforts, her children have everything they need.  She has a vegetable stall located in the municipal market in her area.  She has been doing this type of work for several years, and she has managed to build up a good reputation, which has enabled her to attract many regular customers.

She is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she will be able to buy vegetables in larger quantities.  This gives her the advantage of buying at slightly lower prices so that she can make more profit, which is her main goal.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: María Roselia

texts.es: María Roselia de 61 años de edad, es una señora muy dedicada al bienestar de su hogar, vive junto a un hijo quien es su único apoyo y con quien dividen los gastos del hogar. María posee una venta de sodas de diferentes sabores y hielo, lo que comercializa en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  con el cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de sodas, las cuales se venden muy bien sobre todo los fines de semana. María tiene un enorme deseo de poder salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor junto a su hijo, por lo que espera mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Roselia, 61, is very dedicated to the well-being of her household.  She lives with a son who is her only support and with whom she shares the household expenses.  María has a business selling ice and various types of soda, which she sells in her home.  

She's requesting a loan from Integral with which she'll be able to buy wholesale soda, which sells very well, especially on the weekend.  María has a huge desire to be able to get ahead and have a better life with her son.  This is why she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soda to supply her business

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes! Este es el Grupo Dio Es Amor y Mi Guia.

Shirley es la Presidenta del grupo y tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores, una de ellas – Dóris - es también un miembro del grupo.

Shirley se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de zapatos desde hace casi 15 años (antes era ama de casa). Los cosméticos los vende por catálogo, a sus vecinas y amigas. Los zapatos los compra en Lima y los vende en la selva, de donde es originaria, porque allá no hay tanta variedad de zapatos. A Shirley le encantan sus negocios porque le dan la oportunidad de conversar y viajar, lo que a ella le gusta mucho porque es una persona muy alegra.

Este préstamo Shirley lo va a usar para comprar cosméticos y zapatos. Shirley está muy orgullosa de pertenecer al Grupo Dio Es Amor y Mi Guia, ya que es un grupo muy puntual y responsable, donde todos los miembros pagan sus préstamos a tiempo y horas.

Hace unos meses Shirley fue asaltada, arrastrada unos metros de una moto-taxi, y hasta ahora tiene problemas en la cadera y lesiones en el brazo. Pero Shirley no quier pensar en los problemas del pasado y solo en el futuro que ha de venir. Su esperanza en este momento es ver su hija mayor feliz y realizada personalmente.

*En la parte superior izquierda en la fotografía pequeña aparece la Sra. Patricia.
texts.en:
Good afternoon!  This is the Dios Es Amor y Mi Guia  (God Is Love and My Guide) group.  Shirley is the President of the group.  She is 62 years old, married, and has two grown children.  One of them, Doris, is a member of the group.

Shirley has been selling cosmetics and shoes for almost 15 years (before that she was a housewife).  She sells the cosmetics by catalog to her neighbors and friends.  She buys the shoes in Lima, and she sells them in the forest that she is from.  She does this because they do not have much of a variety of shoes there.  She likes this very much because she is a very happy person.

Shirley is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics and shoes.  Shirley is very proud to belong to the Dios Es Amor y Mi Guia group because it is a very punctual and responsible group.  All of the members make their loan payments on time.

A few months ago Shirley was assaulted.  She was dragged for some meters by a ‘moto-taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle]. She still has problems with her hip and injuries to her arm.  However, Shirley does not want to think about past problems.  She only wants to think about what is coming in the future.  At this time her hope is to see her daughter happier and personally fulfilled.

Shirley is the woman who talks in the video.  She is the second one from the right.  Shirley appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more products like shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Raúl Antonio

texts.es: Raúl Antonio 41 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y responsable con su hogar, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Raúl posee un molino en su casa de habitación el cual alquila para que las personas puedan llegar a moler diferentes tipos de alimentos como maíz, verduras y otros más. Debido a que es el único molino que se encuentra en el sector posee mucho clientes razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar un molina más y repuestos para el que ya posee, de esta forma el espera atender a más clientes lo cual será de mucho beneficio para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl Antonio, 41, is a very hardworking and family-oriented man, he lives with his wife and two young children. He owns a grinder in his home which he rents so that people can grinder different types of food such as corn, vegetables and more. 

As it is the only grinder in the area, Raúl has many customers which is why he is seeking a loan from Integral with which he will be able to buy one more grinder and spares for the one he already owns. In this manner, he hopes to serve more customers which would be of great benefit to him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a mill for business purposes.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! El grupo “Los Girasoles” es  un grupo formado por 8 socios y está empezando ya el quinto ciclo. Un de los miembros de este grupo es Julia, que se dedica a la mecánica - o más específicamente a la muellería, siendo especializada en la venta, servicio de cambio y mantenimiento de los muelles (pieza o parte de un carro que va junto a la llanta).

Julia y su esposo tienen una larga experiencia en esta actividad, que empezaron hace 15 años porque el esposo de Julia tenía conocimientos en esa área. Los principales clientes de su negocio son los propietarios de autos, ómnibus, etc., y su principal característica es la rapidez en su trabajo.

Julia va a utilizar su préstamo en la compra de piezas para su negocio (muelles).

Julia tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16, 10 y 8 años de edad. Su sueño es terminar de construir su propia casa y sacar a sus hijos profesionales. En la fotografía, Julia está ubicada en el centro, con una casaca verde y una chompa roja. Julia se alegra que personas de todo el mundo ayuden a micro-empresarios que necesitan apoyo como ella.

La fotografía adicional que se pegó es la de Yessica, que no pudo estar presente en el día en que se sacó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! The "Sunflowers" Group is a group formed by 8 members and are beginning their fifth cycle. One of the members of this group is Julia, who works as a mechanic, specifically shocks - the sale, service, and maintenance of such. 

Julia and her husband have a lot of experience with this activity, which they began 15 years ago because Julia's husband knew about this area. Their principal clientes are those who own their own cars, buses, etc., and their foremost characteristic is how quickly they perform their job.

Julia is going to use the loan to purchase shocks.

Julia is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and three children of 16, 10 and 8 years old. Her dream is to finish building her own home and to make sure her children become professionals. In the photograph, Julia is located in the middle with a green jacket and a red sweater. Julia is happy that people throughout the world support micro-enterprise clients that need assistance such as herself.

The additional photograph that is inserted is of Yessica, who could not be present the day of the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase shocks

loans.name: Rossmery Esmeralda

texts.es: Rossmery Esmeralda de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su hijo y su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y pupusas, tiene varios años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la materia, donde comercia es muy transitado por las personas lugar y por la de los alrededores, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo es delicioso, las personas la prefieren por la calidad del material, los buenos precios y además por el excelente servicio el mas rápido de la localidad; Rossmery es una mujer enérgica, luchadora y con muchos sueños que no ha podido alcanzar, esta trabajando duro  para lograrlo pues solo a así obtendrá el éxito, quiere aumentar la producción porque en los últimos meses aumento la demanda pero para ello necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles etc. Rossmery tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, es responsable y asegura poder cancelar la deuda a la vez que confía que podrá darle a su familia  una vida plena.
texts.en:
Rossmery Esmeralda is 26 years old and lives with her son and her mother in her own home.  She has a business making and selling tortillas and pupusas.  She has had this business for several years, and she has gained a lot of experience in this type of work.  She has many customers from the local and surrounding areas since everything that she makes is delicious.  People prefer to come to her for the quality of her dishes, her low prices, and also for the excellent service, which is the fastest in the area.

She is a dedicated and energetic woman who has many dreams that she has not been able to realize.  She is working hard in order to achieve them, since this is the only way she will obtain success.  She wants to increase her production, since in recent months their has been an increase in customer demand.  In order to do this, she needs to make a new investment in her business.  For this reason she is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL that will all her to buy corn, cheese, beans, fried pork skins and other items.

Rossmery has good credit references from those who know her.  She is responsible and gives her assurance that she will be able to repay her debt and at the same time provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, beans and fried pork skins.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a housewife and had a small hog raising business while her spouse is a driver. Together, they raise a child and would like to increase their income, so she is now asking for additional capital of P9,000 to maintain their businesses. From the loan, she will buy crude oil and gasoline to use in her husband's transport business. Someday, she hopes to keep making their businesses profitable so they will have funds for their child's college education and finally achieve a decent way of life.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and gasoline for a motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Nelly Yesenia

texts.es: Nelly Yesenia de 26 años de edad, es una joven madre de dos pequeños hijos por quienes desea salir adelante, así mismo vive junto a su esposo. Nelly tiene la bendición de poder tener su negocio propio, el cual es muy estable, ella se dedica a la venta de recargas de saldo a celulares y también vende celulares, cargadores y otros accesorios. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lo que representa una enorme ventaja puesto que puede dedicarse a este y también al cuidado de sus hijos.  Nelly solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero requerido para invertir en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de saldo para diferentes telefonías y así también para comprar más accesorios de celulares. Nelly tiene muchos clientes y es lo que espera aprovechar al máximo para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly Yesenia, 26, is a young mother of two small children for whom she wants to get ahead.  She also lives with her husband.  Nelly has been blessed with being able to have her own business, which is very stable.

She works selling phone cards for mobile phones as well as mobile phones, chargers, and other accessories.  Her business is in her house, which is a big advantage because she can work on it as well as take care of her children.

Nelly is requesting a loan so she'll have the money necessary to invest in her business, buying wholesale cards for different phones as well as more accessories for mobile phones.

Nelly has a lot of customers and she hopes to take full advantage of this to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy credit for mobile phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina  de 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y así mismo le ayuda a ella al negocio que posee. Josefina trabaja vendiendo diversidad de ropa para hombres, niños, y mujeres, la cual la comercializa por las calles, en donde se turna para poder ir a diferentes lugares en los cuales el comercio es muy bueno, así mismo municipios en los cuales sabe que puede vender más ya que estos tipos de ventas  son muy pocas en estos sectores como pueblos y cantones lo que le permite tener más clientes. Para poder seguir trabajando de esta manera, ella necesita contar con capital de trabajo necesario para incrementar la cantidad de ropa que posee, comprando por mayor para obtenerla a precios más bajos. Josefina solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  por medio del cual pueda llevar a cabo lo antes mencionado y vender más ropa.
texts.en:
Josefina, 59, lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer in addition to helping her in her business.  Josefina works selling a variety of clothing for men, women, and children, which she sells in the street, where she takes turns going to different places where business is very good.  She also goes to towns where she knows she can sell more, because this type of business is scare in these towns and cantons, which allows her to have more customers.

To be able to continue working this way, she needs sufficient working capital to increase the amount of clothing she has, buying wholesale to get it at lower prices.  Josefina's requesting a loan from Integral so she can carry out what was just described and sell more clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Cesar Armando

texts.es: Cesar Armando de 24 años de edad es un joven  muy responsable y trabajador, el se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de productos varios como jabones, detergentes, papel higiénico y otros más que vende de forma ambulante. César está casado y actualmente se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres ya que está construyendo su casa, la cual debido a falta de ingresos no ha podido finalizar. Por esta razón, César solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar duralitas, pisos y pinturas para finalizar la construcción de su hogar. Cesar es un joven lleno de muchos sueños que desea lograr junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Cesar Armando, 24, is a very responsible and hardworking man. He makes his living selling various products such as soap, detergent, toilet paper and so on which he sells as a street vendor. 

Cesar is married and is currently living in his parent's home as he is building his home but due to a lack of income, he has not been able to finish it. That is why Cesar is seeking a loan from Integral so that he can have the money he needs to buy Duralita [type of fiber cement roofing material], flooring and paint to finish building his home. Cesar is a young man full of dreams that he hopes to turn into a reality along with his wife.

loans.use: to buy materials to build his home.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad tanto alimenticios como para el hogar, Sebastiana es una persona muy alegre y amable, quien debe esforzarse mucho por salir adelante y poder contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. Desde hace 3 años que ella posee la tienda en su casa de habitación, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona y a pesar de que tiene mucha competencia en los alrededores, siempre es preferida por las personas del lugar, ya que es de mucha confianza en toda la zona. Sebastiana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para surtir más su negocio, comprando granos básicos, detergentes, desinfectantes, pan, leche, huevos, productos lácteos y todo lo que es más necesario y que sus clientes solicitan más en la tienda, así mismo desea poder incluir productos nuevos, los cuales a pesar que tienen poco tiempo de estar en el mercado poseen una gran demanda como golosinas y bebidas, las cuales le asegurarían aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is thirty years old and lives with her husband and two young children.  She has a store in which she sells groceries and nutritious foods for household consumption.  She is a very cheerful and friendly person.  She needs to make a lot of effort to get ahead and have everything that she needs in order to live a dignified life.  For the last three years she has had her shop in her home and has become very well-known in the area.  In spite of the fact that there is a lot of competition all around her, local people always prefer to come to her, since they put a lot of trust in her.

She is seeking a loan so that she will be able to buy everything necessary to stock her store.  This includes grains, bread, milk, eggs and dairy products, as well as detergents, disinfectants and other items which are most in demand by her customers.  She also wishes to be able to include new products -- items which are in high demand in spite of only recently coming on the market, such as candies and drinks.  These items will help her increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy candies and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Aracema Madilia

texts.es: Aracema de 52 años de edad, es una señora muy responsable quien posee muy buenas referencias, vive junto a su hija y una nieta, por quien trabajan muy duro. Aracema posee una librería donde comercializa: cuadernos, libros, diferentes tipos de papeles entre otras cosas más, así también comercializa carteras de cuero. La librería está ubicada en su casa de habitación y es la única en la zona, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL y de esta manera surtir al máximo su negocio, ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar sus ganancias, lo que es muy importante para Aracema ya que así podrá contar con una vida mejor para su familia.
texts.en: Aracema, 52, is a very responsible lady who has very good references.  She lives with her daughter and granddaughter and she works very hard for them.  Aracema has a stationery shop where she sells notebooks, books, various types of paper and also leather purses.  It’s located in her house and is the only one in the neighborhood which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to stock the store as best as possible because she will be able to increase profits that way which is very important to Aracema because that’s how she will be able to have a better life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her stationery shop.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa es madre soltera de tres niños quienes dependen por completo de ella. María posee una parcela en la cual cultiva diferentes tipos de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, en cilindros hechos de acero inoxidable, lo que le permite mantener frescas las semillas, estos granos son los que luego comercializa  con sus diferentes clientes los cuales le compran por mayor, este es un negocio el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario durante muchos años, es por ello que María cuenta con una gran experiencia lo que lo hace más llamativos para los diferentes clientes. Ella solicita  un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de abono, maíz, pesticidas, lo que le  permitirá elaborar un mejor trabajo y obtener mayores ganancias lo cual es esencial para su hogar.
texts.en: María Teresa’s a single mother of three children who are completely dependent on her.  María has a parcel of land where she grows various basic grains like corn and beans that she stores in stainless steel cylinders thereby keeping the seeds fresh for subsequent sale to various customers who always buy at wholesale.  This is a business that’s made it possible for her to have all her needs met for several years so María has quite a bit of experience which makes her more attractive to various customers.  She’s requesting a loan in order to have the money needed to buy larger amounts of manure, corn and pesticide which will help her do her work better and obtain higher profits which are essential for her home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.es: Edgar Omar vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de tres años de edad, tanto Edgar como su compañera de vida son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras y ambos se dedican al negocio familiar, el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Debido a que la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que posee Edgar solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar nuevos productos para la tienda como embutidos, lácteos  y otros más, lo cual le permita contar con un negocio surtido que le genera más ganancias.
texts.en: Edgar Omar lives with his wife and three-year-old son.  Both Edgar and his wife are responsible, very hardworking people; they both work in the family business which is a store selling perishables and basic staples.  Because the store is the only source of income Edgar has he’s requesting a loan to buy new products for the store like canned goods, dairy products and others that will make it possible for him to have a stocked store that generates him more profits.

loans.use: to buy perishables for his store.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Rosemary, 19 years old, lives in the town of Lugazi, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her small business, selling fresh milk. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more milk for resale, and will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and to pay for basic family needs such as food and medical expenses. Rosemary hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own another business such as a retail shop. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale,

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a dressmaking business in the Philippines for 25 years, and earns more income from farming rice. Tessie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her dressmaking business. Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock such as candy, bread, instant products, soap etc.

loans.name: Levi Antonio

texts.es: Levi, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea cercana de OLanchito, Yoro. Levi actualmente trabaja en una compañía privada y para obtener más ingresos, hace un año que decidió implementar un negocio de venta de saldos para teléfono celular mediante recargas y tarjetas con la compañía telefónica TIGO. Vende con sus compañeros, amigos, familias y demás personas particulares. El vende saldo en donde este a través de celular a celular. El préstamo que ha solicitado es de 5,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar saldos y tarjetas por cantidad mayor con el objetivo de obtener más ganancias. Es su primer préstamo y espera que todo salga bien para mantener un buen record crediticio con la institución y hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Levi is 30 years old and married. He has two children, and lives in a village near OLanchito, Yoro. 

Levi presently works for a private company, and to get more income, a year ago he decided to launch a business selling prepaid amounts for cell phones, through top-ups and phone cards, with the telephone company TIGO. 

He sells to co-workers, friends, family members, and other people. He sells prepaid amounts, where this is cell phone to cell phone. 

The loan he has requested is for 5,000 lempiras, with which he is going to buy prepaid amounts and phone cards in greater quantity, with the aim of getting more earnings. 

It is his first loan, and he hopes that everything will turn out well. This is so that he can keep a good credit rating with the institution and make his business grow, in order to help his family financially.

loans.use: To buy top-up minutes and prepaid cell phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a food stall owner in Pallua Sur. She cooks and sells food for daily meals to the people in her village. Violeta, 49 years old, is married and has one child who attends school. Her spouse is also her business partner. Violeta would like to continue generating income so she will be able to give the best education to her child. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients such as meat, carrots and beans to cook and sell. She hopes to cook more delectable meals to be able to satisfy her customers' demand for delicious foods. Violeta promises to repay her loan and hopes to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, carrots and beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Mwanamusi

texts.en:
Mwanamusi is still working in her tailoring business, making clothing for women, men, and children. She has been working in this field for several years and thanks to the work, she now has a well-formed clientele. 

Mwanamusi narrates that the previous loan was of help to improving both her business and the living standards of her family. Because of the requests that she receives, she is asking for another credit in order to purchase fabrics and sewing thread and in that way complete all of the requests. 

Mwanamusi desires to own a tailoring and dressmaking training college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing thread.

loans.name: Marie Anne

texts.en: Florita is 56 years old and married. She is from Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. Florita has been raising bananas for 10 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month. Her four children have helped her to take care of the bananas. Florita joined GDMPC in 2012. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель 30 лет. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Асель начала свой бизнес в пошиве женской одежды на дому со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, ежемесячный доход Асель от бизнес – деятельности составляет 20,000 сом (KGS), доходы позволили Асель купить машинку и утюг для работы.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асель обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материала и ниток. Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса путем покупки швейной машинки более усовершенствованного вида.
texts.en: Asel is 30 years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business of sewing women's clothing at home in 2009 with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Asel's monthly business income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS), and the earnings allowed her to purchase a sewing machine and an iron.  In order to further develop her business, Asel requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase materials and thread.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by purchasing a more advanced sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase materials and thread

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василий торгует женскими и мужскими ремнями на центральном рынке города. Он работал раньше реализатором, но вскоре открыл свое дело. Василий имеет хорошую репутацию. Он целеустремленный и трудолюбивый.

Василий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на расширение ассортимента. Дополнительную прибыль он хочет вложить в бизнес, а также доделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Vasiliy sells women's and men's belts at the city's central market.  He previously worked as a distributor, but then opened his own business.  Vasiliy has a good reputation.  He is goal-oriented and hardworking.  Vasiliy is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia to expand his merchandise selection.  He wants to invest the additional profit into the business and also to finish repairs at home.

loans.use: to expand his merchandise selection

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 25 years, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Yaser owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to buy two refrigerators and a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a generator

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: Rosa Elva de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos Johana y Rene en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras chiles, papas, cebollas, tomates,  entre otros comercia en el mercado de la localidad donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre esta a la orden de las personas que la visitan; Rosa es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, trabaja día con día con gran esfuerzo para lograrlo, quiere acrecentar el negocio y para ello necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papas, cebolla, chiles, tomates, etc. Rosa Elva tiene buenas referencias  de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Elva, 48, lives with her children, Johana and Rene, in her own house.  She sells vegetables like chilies, potatoes, onions and tomatoes, among others in the local market where she lives. She has a large, regular clientele that prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices and in addition her service is unequalled.  She is always at their disposal when they visit her.  

Rosa is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will help her reach success.  She works day to day with much enthusiasm to reach it.  She wants to increase business and to do so needs to invest which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy potatoes, onions, chilies, tomatoes, etc.  Rosa Elva has good payment references and she is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that she’ll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, chilies and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is from Looc, Plaridel. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children. 

To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does fishing. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns PHP 5,000 a month for these activities. 

This year, Rosalie joined GDMPC. Rosalie is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000, which will be used to repair their fishing boat. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина занимается продажей женской одежды на протяжении 19 лет. Она снимает помещение в торговом центре. Марина предоставляет своим покупателем качественный и популярный товар. 
Она просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 4000 гривен на закупку осенней одежды: футболки, кофты, юбки, свитера и брюки. Дополнительную прибыль она хочет вложить в бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Marina has been involved in selling women's clothing for 19 years.  She leases a space at a shopping center.  Marina provides her customers with quality and popular merchandise.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 hryvnia to purchase autumn clothing, such as t-shirts, shirts, skirts, sweaters and pants.  She wants to invest the additional profit into the business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase autumn clothing, such as t-shirts, shirts, skirts, sweaters and pants

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья продает женскую и мужскую одежду на центральном рынке города. У нее собственное торговое место. Наталья знает, на какой товар  есть спрос. Онапросит предоставить ей кредит в сумме  4000 гривен на закупку сезонной одежды. Дополнительную прибыль она хочет вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Natalya sells women's and men's clothing at the city's central market.  She owns her retail space.  Natalya knows which merchandise is in demand.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal clothing.  She wants to invest additional profit into developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 46 years old and married. She is from Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She has one child who has helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for four years and earn PHP 6,000 a month. 

Aurelia joined GDMPC this year. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
This is Belinda.  She is 38 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Ramil, a driver, and a mother to her children.  Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating her business.  At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Belinda operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities to members of the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or a single egg.  She earns money by acquiring supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Belinda is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP.  She will use this loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Belinda hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Margarita Del Transito

texts.es: Margarita del Transito de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de la localidad donde reside, tiene diferentes platillos desayunos y almuerzos, pollo, carnes, arroz, ensaladas, etc. se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo elabora con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Margarita es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, en las ultimas semanas ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, etc. Margarita del Transito tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Margarita del Transito is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children. She earns her living selling food in the community where she lives. She offers a range of dishes for breakfasts and lunches such as chicken, meat, rice, salads etc. to her many customers. They seek her out because she uses quality ingredients, charges fair prices, and provides great service.

Margarita is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is always on the look out for new ways to be successful. In the last few weeks demand has increased, and she wishes to take advantage of the situation by investing loan money from INTEGRAL in the purchase of meat, vegetables, basic grains, drinks etc.

Margarita del Transito has a good repayment record and is confident that she will be able to pay off her debt, and at the same time provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: purchase meat, vegetables, basic grains, drinks

loans.name: Ayissogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYISSOGBE est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, Colette, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 33 ans. Colette est mariée à un certain Martin et a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Colette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Colette vend des galettes (faite à base du blé et de l'huile végétale) à son domicile. Il y a environs vingt ans que Colette exerce cette activité. Colette s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Colette ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Colette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYISSOGBE, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AYISSOGBE group is made up of three women who are friends and belong to the same savings group.

The group's representative, Colette, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 33 years old, married to man named Martin, and the mother of five children, all in school and her dependents.  Colette never attended school.  She and Martin live together with their children and jointly take care of the various needs of the household.

For the past twenty years or so, Colette has been selling "galettes" (flat round cakes made with wheat and vegetable oil) from her home.  She buys her supplies in her region and in a town in Benin.

In order to raise the level of her activity, Colette would like to increase her sales quantities.  This will allow her to better meet the demand from her customers.

For this reason, Colette is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the AYISSOGBE group.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 29 years old and a single person.  He is an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli, but currently he and his family live in the greater Fuzuli region. 

He opened his shop to sell spare parts, engine oil, and other things for cars.  He loves his work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business. He now needs a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manat in order to expand his shop to put there more spare parts for car.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. Vugar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli, but now he settled in Baku region with his wife and children. He loves his family. Vugar has been in business for nine years. Now he needs 1500 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) to buy food products (rice, flour, teas, milk etc.) for improving his work.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 48 years old, married, and has seven children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. He lives in Ibb, Yemen.  He worked as a chief in KSA then he enabled to collect money. He would like to buy a bus but he doesn`t have sufficient money so, he has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER to buy a bus from AMB. In this way, he will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life, and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy a bus for transportation

loans.name: Sandra Idalia

texts.es: Sandra Idalia de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Roberto y su hijo de ocho años; ella se dedica a la venta de atoles, de arroz, de piña, de maíz, poleada, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, tiene su pequeño negocio en un lugar muy estratégico transitado por muchas personas, ya tiene mucha clientela fija pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad de su producto, los buenos precios pero sobre todo el excelente servicio, Sandra es una mujer dedicada a su labor dispuesta a salir adelante, se esfuerza todos los días por alcanzar ese éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cereales, arroz, piña, maíz, canela etc. Sandra Idalia tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Idalia, 24, lives with her life companion, Roberto, and their 8-year-old son.  She sells ‘atoles’ [corn based beverages] made with rice, pineapple, corn and ‘poleada’ [hot drink made with flour and milk], among others.  She’s had the business for several years and has acquired much experience that makes it possible for her to earn higher profits.  Her small business is located in a very strategic spot with lots of passersby.  She has a large, regular clientele because people prefer her because of the quality of her products, her good prices and above all for the excellent service.

Sandra is a woman who is dedicated to her work and determined to get ahead.  She strives daily to reach success.  Like all good merchants, she wants to increase production but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy cereals, rice, pineapple, corn, cinnamon, etc.  Sandra Idalia has good payment references and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan as scheduled while at the same time provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals, rice, pineapple and cinnamon.

loans.name: Fatima-Alzhra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fatima-Alzhra and consists of five women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 210,000 YER.

Noriah is 36 years old, and she is a married woman. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She has tried to work hard. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. In the future, she hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: To buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. for her house

loans.name: Victoria Emilia

texts.es: Victoria Emilia de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y ya tiene varios años con el negocio pues le ha traído muy buenos resultados tiene mucha clientela, la prefieren por la calidad de su producto, los buenos precios pero sobre todo el excelente servicio,  Victoria es una mujer dedicada a su hogar, su familia es lo mas importante en su vida, desde hace algún tiempo han tenido desperfectos en su vivienda y para seguridad de todos desea repararlas pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, cemento, herramienta, etc. Victoria Emilia tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Victoria Emilia is 51 years old, and lives with her son. She raises chickens, and already has several years with this business, as it has brought her very good results. She has many customers, and they prefer her because of the quality of her product, the good prices, but especially for the excellent service.

Victoria is a woman devoted to her home; her family is the most important thing in her life. For some time she has had deficiencies in her home and for everyone's safety she wishes to fix them. But she does not have enough capital to support her in this, and that is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy roof tiles, cement, tools, etc. 

Victoria Emilia has good payment references, is responsible, and says she will be able to pay off the debt. At the same time she has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life, as they deserve.

loans.use: To buy roof tiles, cement and and tools.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou.  She previously took out a loan of 9,000 PHP that she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better because a greater variety of items to sell will result in better profit.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes her business continues to grow in the coming years.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal vegetables for her son's vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that her nephews and nieces will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shemo

texts.en:
Ms. Shemo is 31 years old, a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years.  She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. 

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Shemo's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 
 
She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 30000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 
 
She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls for her hand-embroidery business.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Amina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Amina has been working hard to manage her small business selling fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh fruit for resale, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and more capital. Amina hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruit for resale.

loans.name: Shairkul

texts.ru:
Шаиркул 62 года, вдова, проживает с семьей сына. Шаиркул, рано выйдя замуж, с 1970  года начала  заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Шаиркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 2,90 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми. Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Шаиркул смогла дать образование детям - ее младший сын стал преподавателем и на сегодняшний день работает в местной школе. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шаиркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычка на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Шаиркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Shairkul is 62 years old, a widow and lives with her son's family.  Having gotten married early, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1970, having started this business with 5,000 som.  Thanks to Shairkul's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows with offspring and 2.90 hectares of land with potatoes and cereal crops.  Thanks to the business earnings, she was able to provide education for her children - her youngest son became a teacher and works at a local school today.  In order to further develop her business, Shairkul requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a bull for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a bull for fattening up

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Samuel y sus tres hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante para damas, caballeros y niños, vende camisas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, trajes, etc., tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permita obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles además del excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre esta al frente buscando nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, como toda comerciante quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Rosa Amelia tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
