texts.en:
Rosa Amelia, 44, lives with her life companion, Samuel, and their three children.  She sells clothes for women, men and children from place to place.  She sells shirts, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, etc. and has been in business for many years which has led her to acquire much experience that means higher profits for her.  She sells all around the place where she lives and has a lot of regular customers who prefer her because she always has what they need at really affordable prices in addition to her excellent service.

Rosa is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s tenacious and always looking for new opportunities to reach success.  Like all merchants, she wants to reinvest but needs capital to back her up which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy clothes at wholesale.  Rosa Amelia has good payment references and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time has hope that she’ll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is from the Senaki district, West Georgia. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons (18 and 20 years old), both students. Rusudan works as a teacher and earns a monthly salary. The family is involved in an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where they grow nuts, maize and laurel leaves. They have a vineyard and produce wine and vodka and they also own 2 pigs.  In addition, Rusudan runs a small dairy farm with two milk cows and 4 calves. She milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. Rusudan sells all of her agricultural products at the Senaki open market. Rusudan’s husband gets wood from the forest and sells it in nearby villages. 

Rusudan has applied for this loan to increase her number of cattle by purchasing a milk cow. This will allow Rusudan to receive more milk for her dairy and increase her sales. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and finance her sons' education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos. Para María lo más importante es su familia y es por eso que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y ayudar a su esposo en los muchos gastos del hogar. Ella  se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya ha adquirido una buena y fiel clientela. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y es esta la razón por la que lucha con todas sus fuerzas para mantener vivo el negocio que por muchos años les ha proporcionado lo necesario para sobrevivir. María quiere ampliar su negocio ya que la demanda que recibe es grande y esto le ayudara a generar mayores ingresos. Es por todas estas razones que tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (maíz y harinas) al por mayor para seguir produciendo sus tan ricas tortillas.
texts.en:
María, 53, lives in her own house with her family group consisting of her life companion and their four children.  For María, her family is most important and that’s why she works hard to provide their daily bread and to help her husband cover many of the household expenses.

She works making tortillas to sell.  She’s been in this business for many years which has led to a good, regular clientele.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals and this is why she strives with all her strength to keep her business alive which for so many years has provided what’s been necessary to survive.

María wants to expand the business since demand is big and this will help her generate higher income.  It’s because of all these reasons that she made the decision to request this loan from Integral to buy raw materials (corn and flour) at wholesale to continue making her so delicious tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is now serving in the military. He started working with his wife on their home business making pickles and added making cookies and cheese to sell. Seeing that his wife is happy in this business, he decided to help her so she can improve the business. He has applied for a loan for her to buy more food containers and milk to make more cheese.

loans.use: to buy more food containers and milk to make more cheese.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 27-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Amani helps in supporting the family by adding another small source of income from selling kitchen wares. 

She now wants to add variety to what she has, so she applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more home products other than kitchen wares.

loans.use: to bring in more home products other than kitchen wares.

loans.name: Sauda's Group

texts.en:
Sauda's Group is comprised of two hard-working women.  Sauda is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  For the past four years, Sauda has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Sauda has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale and will help Sauda generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living.  Sauda hopes that in the future she will be able to add additional items like caps, plates and saucepans to her inventory. 

Sauda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Inojat

texts.ru: Иноят преподает в сельской школе учительницей начальных классов.    У неё 4 дочери все учатся в старших классах и во всем помогают своей маме.   Муж Иноят находится на заработках за пределами города и приезжает домой раз в год.   За хозяйством присматривают женщины. Дома выращивают скот и его дочки уже знают все преимущества этого бизнеса.   Иноят также занимается пошивом национальных одеял и матрацев, у неё много клиентов но основной доход от откорма скота.   Поэтому Иноят хочет расширить свой бизнес и на полученный кредит планирует купить несколько голов мелкогорогатого скота.   Заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку.
texts.en:
Inojat is a teacher, teaching at a rural elementary school. She has four daughters, who are all enrolled in high school and who all help their mother. Inojat's husband is a migrant worker outside the city, and comes home once a year. The women look after the household. They raise livestock at home, and Inojat's daughters already know all the advantages of the business.

Inojat further works with sewing national blankets and mattresses. She has many clients but the main income comes from fattening livestock. Therefore Inojat wants to broaden her business and for the loan received she plans to purchase a few heads of sheep and goats. She thanks our organization in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 48 years old, and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married, and her husband works as a contractor. She has three children between the ages of 31 and 23.

Kebbeh has been selling oil, paper, rice, etc for the past 25 years. Sometimes she experiences low sales, but most of the time her business does well. 

Kebbeh is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, paper, rice, etc for her business. In the future, she hopes to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, paper, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is 39 years old.  She has two children whom are learning at school.  She has sold goods and food in her grocery store and grown rice for 10 years to earn a living.  She makes 5,000,000 VND a month, and has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2009.  During the last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy beverages, canned goods, snacks, tissue for selling in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, snacks, tissue for selling in her grocery store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco, es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 59 años de edad, es casado. Don Francisco es dueño de una despensa desde hace 12 años. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que después gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha salido adelante y ha crecido.
Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia y también cumplir con su clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar de insumos de primera necesidad que le hace falta, como ser bebidas, lácteos, panificados, frutas y verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 59-year-old married man from the city of Santaní.  He has owned a store for twelve years.  He says that he started with a small operation, but thanks to his effort he has gotten ahead and grown his business.

His goal is to keep working so that he can keep supporting his family and keep his customers satisfied.  He is seeking this loan in order to buy grocery items that he currently does not have in stock, such as beverages, dairy products, bread, pastries, fruits and vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, bread, pastries, fruits and vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Edcel

texts.en:
Edcel, 20 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Solinog, Calamba and is earning from his gardening business. He has had this business for almost three years now and he earns PHP 3,000 a month. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing the amount of PHP 3,000 from GDMPC Microcredit, which he just joined recently, to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.
